reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Solid upgrade
reviewText:
The AirPods 4 offer a blend of convenience and enhanced audio performance, making them a compelling choice for both new users and those upgrading from earlier models.

Design and Comfort

The AirPods 4 maintain Apple's signature sleek design, with a compact case that's easy to carry. The earbuds fit comfortably in the ears, suitable for extended use without discomfort. However, as with any universal fit, individual comfort may vary.

Audio Performance

Compared to the AirPods 3, the AirPods 4 deliver a richer bass experience, enhancing the overall sound quality. While the midrange and treble remain clear, the added bass depth provides a more balanced listening experience. It's important to note that while the sound quality is improved, it may not match the depth and clarity of higher-end models like the AirPods Pro 2.

Active Noise Cancellation (ANC)

A significant addition to the AirPods 4 is Active Noise Cancellation. Users have reported that the ANC is effective, especially considering the open-ear design without silicone tips. While it may not completely isolate external noise as efficiently as in-ear models, it provides a noticeable reduction in ambient sounds, making it suitable for everyday environments.

Microphone and Call Quality

The microphone quality is adequate for phone calls, capturing voices clearly in quiet settings. However, in noisier environments, the microphone may struggle to filter out background noise, which can affect call clarity.

Battery Life and Charging

The AirPods 4 offer up to 30 hours of total listening time with the charging case, providing ample usage between charges. The inclusion of a USB-C charging case aligns with modern charging standards, offering faster and more convenient recharging options.

Pricing and Value

Priced at $179, the AirPods 4 with ANC sit between the standard AirPods and the AirPods Pro 2. While they offer several enhancements over the standard model, including ANC and improved sound quality, potential buyers should consider whether these features meet their specific needs, especially when compared to the higher-priced AirPods Pro 2.

Conclusion

The Apple AirPods 4 are a commendable upgrade, offering improved audio performance, effective ANC, and a comfortable design. They are particularly well-suited for users seeking a balance between price and features without venturing into the premium tier. However, those requiring top-tier noise cancellation and audio fidelity might still prefer the AirPods Pro 2.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2025

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 A Major Upgrade – Totally Worth It!
reviewText:
I recently got these Apple AirPods 4 for my girlfriend to upgrade from her Gen 2, and the difference is absolutely night and day! The sound quality is crystal clear, and the personalized spatial audio really enhances the listening experience, making it feel like you're right in the middle of the action. The sweat and water resistance is a great addition, especially since she likes to work out with them, and they hold up perfectly during exercise.

The USB-C charging is a nice touch as well, making it easier to charge with the same cable she uses for her other devices. Overall, these AirPods are a fantastic choice if you're looking for an upgrade or a gift. The sound quality, comfort, and features make them totally worth the investment.

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars
 Good, but not perfect
reviewText: I've used the 2nd generation for years and loved them. Since they were discontinued I decided to try these. I like them, they fit snuggly in my ears and sound a bit better than my previous set. They charge fast and I like that they use the standard charger cord this time instead of the special gen 2 cord. I haven't had any problems with connecting which was a regular problem with my gen 2 set. They seem well made. Since, I use these with an android phone so I can't speak to the other features that I don't have access to. However, there are a couple things that I don't like. One is the way the ear buds fit in the case which is awkward and sometimes difficult to get them in and out. The second and biggest is the button placement on the stems which makes it quite difficult to hang up a call. The tap feature from gen 2 was way better and easier to use.

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars
 Good, but the ones with ANC are worth the extra $
reviewText:
So I've had the old Airpods (2nd gen) for years, and they finally started giving out, so decided to try the 4s. At first, I wasnt that impressed. They sounded about the same as my Airpod 2s did while sitting in a quiet environment. HOWEVER, when i took them into the tanning booth (where theres a loud fan sound), I could still very much hear the sound of the tanning fan, and had to raise the volume on the Airpod 4s to almost full volume in order to drown out the sound. Comparing that to my old Airpod 2s, which did a solid job at blocking out that tanning fan sound, I was definitely not impressed.

HOWEVER.. Before returning them, I decided to see if maybe there was a setting I could change that would make them sound better somehow. Eventually I realized I had the Spatial Audio/Head Tracking setting ON, which meant that whenever I would look away from my phone, the sound would adjust and would make it seem like whatever ear was closest to my phone would hear sound the loudest. I didnt see the point of this, so I turned the head tracking setting OFF and kept it at the Fixed" Spatial Audio setting. This seemed to improve the sound quality quite a bit
reviewDate: ESPECIALLY when I discovered songs in Apple Music had certain music with Dolby Atmos/Spatial Audio sound. Normally
column6: I'm a Spotify guy
column7: but when I'm listening with Airpods
column8: I'll prob use Apple Music from now on.

asin: TLDR: Once I turned off the Head Tracking Spatial Audio
reviewTitle: I still wasnt happy with the outer noise I was able to hear while wearing them compared to the Airpods 2. I ultimately upgraded to the Airpods 4 with Active Noise Cancelling
reviewText: and those will be getting 5 stars from me."

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Can’t Beat the Price!
reviewText:
At $99 ($106 after taxes) at the time of purchase it was a steal.

I don’t need anything too fancy. As long as the sound is good and I can listen to my music or podcasts on my commute to/from work, at the gym, taking a walk or just simply out for a few hours and they last without them cutting off then I’m a happy camper.

This is my third pair of AirPods I’ve bought. The first pair were the AirPod 2s which I bought back in 2019 and again in 2020 after I thought I had lost them (which later I found) and so unfortunately/fortunately for me, before I could cancel the order, they were shipped and I simply kept them as a backup pair.

Only recently did my first pair of AirPods 2 finally need to be thrown out because they would no longer last on a full charge, so now I’m using my backup pair of AirPod 2s.

These AirPod 4s are more or less another backup pair and as my title suggests the price was right to purchase. So when my second pair of AirPod 2s no longer last on a full charge, I don’t have to worry about replacing them because I’ll already have a pair of these AirPod 4s.

So as long as the price is right, I’ll always try to have an extra pair.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2025

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Great ANC in a comfortable, portable package
reviewText:
If you're an Apple fan, you've probably already put these in your cart, regardless of reviews. But I am not an Apple fan. In fact, I kind of hate the brand for a plethora of reasons and would not own any of their devices in a perfect world. However, my philosophy is to purchase items that are the best at what I need them for, regardless of brand. Keeping this in mind, I can say that I am very happy with my 4th gen Airpods with ANC. If you are looking for an actual review of this item from someone without the Apple-colored glasses on, keep reading.

I bought the 2nd gen Airpods (not the pros) in 2020 because they were pretty much the best true wireless, non in ear earbuds in the market at that time. The non in ear" part is the biggest requirement for me. My 2020 Airpods have lasted me 4+ years so far
reviewDate: even after I dropped one in water. They're still working great and I have no need to replace them
column6: but I wanted to get a new
column7: upgraded pair and then I can keep the 2020 ones in my bag at all times as a backup.

asin: When I saw that these had ANC
reviewRating: I was skeptical but excited. I have Bose headphones for ANC like when I'm working or on a flight
reviewTitle: and honestly having ANC has been great. But Bose headphones are big and clunky and uncomfortable
reviewText: all things that make them not the greatest for daily use. Reviews for these Airpods said the ANC was pretty good
reviewDate: so I decided to pay the little bit extra and get them. Worse case was that I would never use the ANC and I'd have just overpaid for the same product but 4 years newer. Luckily
column6: best case happened and that is that I am very happy with my purchase and use the ANC modes all the time.

asin: I know not everyone is a fan of the fit of non in ear earbuds like the Airpods have
reviewRating: but for me it's great. In ear earbuds hurt my ears in just a few minutes. Earpod style earbuds (where it points into your ear canal but doesn't insert in) are much more comfortable. The earbud part on these are a bit larger than my 2nd gen Airpods
reviewTitle: but still fit decently. They feel pretty stable in/on my ear for my day to day usage
reviewText: but I don't think I would trust them to stay put for vigorous exercises like running or jogging.

asin: The ANC is fantastic. I wore these on a plane recently and when I had previously flown with my Bose headphones
reviewRating: the ANC made loud popping and crackling noises from time to time
reviewTitle: and especially on take off and landing. But the Airpods' ANC did not do that at all. They cancel out outside noise very well
reviewText: just as well as my Bose headphones
reviewDate: and have less of a "eardrum pressure" feeling than my Boes headphones do.

asin: I like the multiple ANC modes. It has off
reviewTitle: transparent
reviewText: and adaptive. Off means it's just normal earbuds
reviewDate: on filters out almost all outside noise
column6: and transparent lets in all the extra noise so you can hear (similar to open ear headphones like bone conduction ones).

asin: Adaptive mode is great. You may think that it will dynamically choose the level of noise you get based on the name
reviewRating: but it doesn't do that actually. There is a "conversation awareness" feature you can turn on or off that can reduce noise and amplify speech
reviewTitle: but it only activates after *you* talk
reviewText: instead of if someone talks to you. The way the adaptive mode works instead is that you can select the level of noise that you want allowed in. This is great because I have it tuned so I don't hear environmental noises like the dehumidifier
reviewDate: heater
column6: or my roommate working
column7: but I can hear her talk. While using my Airpods with adaptive mode on a recent flight
column8: I could hear the announcements and flight attendants
column9: but the engine sound was greatly reduced and I could hear my music.

asin: Audio in general sounds pretty good. I'm no audiophile by any means
reviewRating: but I know what good quality sounds like. The profile to me is pretty flat
reviewTitle: and with a basic EQ I'm able to get the sound I like. There's not too much lag between video and audio
reviewText: but there's a very noticeable gap for a split second when you first start playing audio after having none playing. For example
reviewDate: a Slack notification on my Macbook might pop up
column6: and then a second or two later the notification sound will play through my airpods. I've seen this same behavior in other Bluetooth headphones and earbuds so I guess it must be a technical limitation or a side effect of some sort of standby state on the connection.

asin: Battery life is pretty good. I went about 5-6 hours recently with ANC Adaptive mode on and music playing before I got a low battery bleep. My gen 2 Airpods could go a bit longer
reviewRating: and I'm guessing these have longer battery life if I were to turn off ANC. The case keeps you charged quickly on the go
reviewTitle: and the case itself charges pretty fast. Plus it charges with USB C now
reviewText: thank god. Practically everything in my life uses C now
reviewDate: except those gen 2 Airpods which use Lightning. I'm glad the EU made Apple finally add C.

asin: The controls now require you to squeeze the stem of the airpods instead of tapping like the gen 2 ones. Because I haven't had the gen 3 Airpods or any of the pro models
reviewRating: maybe that's the way it's been for a while
reviewTitle: but honestly I preferred tapping to pause or change songs. I was able to change the squeeze speed at least because it was a bit cumbersome at first and I kept dislodging my earbud before I got used to it.

asin: The Airpods work well with my Android (Pixel) phone
reviewRating: and really there's no loss in functionality when using them with my phone or PC vs an Apple device. I think the only 2 features that I can't use is 1) use Siri with them (ohhh noooo however will I survive) and 2) pause my music automatically when I remove an earbud (oh well). But all of the various settings and tweaks can really only be changed using an iPad
reviewTitle: iPhone
reviewText: or Mac. I luckily have an iPad (best tablet for digital art) and Macbook (very nice experience for coding or watching movies) so I set them up there
reviewDate: but you can also just use a friend's device or probably a demo model at a store. There are some apps for Android that allow you to make some tweaks
column6: but as of Jan 2025 I think only one of them has partial support for 4th gen Airpods with ANC. With my Pixel
column7: phone calls are clear sounding for both me and who I'm talking to.

reviewRating: I'm very happy with my purchase. I do think they're overpriced (as is everything from Apple)
reviewTitle: but I also think that based on the 2 months I've been using them
reviewText: they've been worth the money. If these last 4 years too
reviewDate: then they'll be beyond worth it. If you are looking for ANC non in ear earbuds with good sound and decent battery life
column6: these are in my opinion the best choice."
column7: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2025

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Sound great with surprisingly good noise “cancelling”
reviewText: Bass is great, microphones are great, charging case is compact. Everything feature and sound-wise about these is pretty great for the price. The only question mark is with noise cancellation since these don’t have the in-hear tips that AirPods Pro have to truly seal out sound. You’d think the noise cancellation would be bad or nonexistent, but no; it works pretty good. I work in a warehouse with loud forklifts and smashing hammers and dropped pallets, and with noise cancellation turned on, I can definitely still hear everything, but the loudness in severely reduced. And in fact, I might even say the fact that the noise cancellation is a step below the Pro is a feature. Being in a warehouse, for safety, I can’t block out ALL sound, but loudness reduction is appreciated. And to be quite honest, with ANC on and the volume somewhat up, it easy to erase sound around. Even if you don’t work in this type of environment, blocking out a lot of sound so that you can then listen to media at a lower volume is good for ear health. My biggest issue is the fit: they’re constantly falling out of my ears hour 2 or 3, and it’s exacerbated by me chewing gum and regularly looking up and down my inventory racks. Even given that, I 100% recommend AirPods 4. These are really great.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2025

These on the other hand Function and work great they never come out of my ear even when i’m sweating or doing alot of moving. they seat so well and don’t irritate me or hurt my ears at all. the durability i’m not so sure of i try and take care of my stuff even tho im rough and clumsy i’ve only dropped them a few times case, and buds but so far nothing bad has happend so id say they are pretty durable for what they are you shouldn’t be doing anything else with them to damage them and blame it on durability. volume control is really nice and they sound amazing like really really good bass and everything. the noise cancellation works so well i work in a heavy duty diesel mechanic shop and when i have them in and there could be 20 diesel trucks running while people are working on them and i cant hear a thing if my music is up. charging is what you would expect its wireless or type c plug its very easy to charge and fast

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Apple AirPods 4 with Active Noise Cancellation - A Game-Changer!
reviewText:
I’ve been using the AirPods for over three weeks two days now, and I have to say, they’ve completely exceeded my expectations. The active noise cancellation is absolutely fantastic—it really creates a peaceful, immersive listening experience, whether I’m commuting, working, or just out running errands. It blocks out background noise so well, making even the most crowded spaces feel quiet and focused.

Sound quality is crisp and clear, with deep bass and rich mids, perfect for everything from music to podcasts. The convenience of the wireless design is a major plus, and the connection with my iPhone is seamless and quick.

They’re also incredibly comfortable and lightweight, with a secure fit that stays in place no matter what I’m doing. Battery life is impressive, easily lasting through my long workdays and commutes without needing a charge.

I truly love these AirPods and can’t recommend them enough. If you’re looking for high-quality wireless earbuds with excellent noise cancellation, these are definitely worth the investment. I’ve already told my family and friends to get a pair themselves haha. Incredibly happy so far.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2025

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Premium experience
reviewText:
I recently purchased the Apple AirPods 4, and I’m absolutely thrilled with them! The sound quality is outstanding, delivering crystal-clear audio with deep bass and rich tones. The noise-cancelling feature is a game-changer—it completely blocks out distractions, letting me fully immerse myself in music, calls, or podcasts.

The fit is comfortable even during long wear, and the battery life is impressive, easily lasting through my daily routines. Pairing with my devices was seamless, and the integration with Apple’s ecosystem enhances the overall experience.

These are hands down the best AirPods yet. Highly recommend them for anyone looking for top-notch audio quality and premium features!
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2025

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars
 Excellent Earbuds, but Shipping Was Delayed
reviewText:
The Apple AirPods 4 Wireless Earbuds are fantastic, and I’m very impressed with their performance. However, the delayed shipping was a slight disappointment.

Amazing Sound Quality: The active noise cancellation and adaptive audio create an immersive listening experience. The personalized spatial audio adds a whole new level to music and movies.
Transparency Mode: Switching between noise cancellation and transparency mode is seamless and works perfectly in different environments.
Convenience: The USB-C charging case and wireless charging make powering up super easy. The battery life is also great for daily use.
Comfortable Fit: The earbuds are lightweight and fit snugly in my ears, even during workouts.

Shipping Delay: The product arrived later than expected, which was disappointing since I was eager to try them out.

Overall:
The AirPods 4 deliver on all fronts with excellent sound, comfort, and features. If not for the shipping delay, this would have been a five-star experience. Highly recommend the product itself!
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2025

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 AirPods 4: Tune Out the World, Tune In to Your Music!
reviewText:
If you're looking for a pair of earbuds that seamlessly blend style, comfort, and impressive audio quality, the Apple AirPods (4th Generation) with ANC are an excellent choice. These earbuds offer a compelling package that caters to both casual listeners and discerning audiophiles.

Sound Quality:

The AirPods 4 deliver a well-balanced sound profile with clear highs, crisp mids, and surprisingly punchy bass. The ANC technology effectively blocks out ambient noise, allowing you to immerse yourself in your music or podcasts without distractions. Whether you're commuting, working, or simply relaxing, these earbuds provide a captivating listening experience.

Comfort and Fit:

Apple has refined the design of the AirPods 4, resulting in a comfortable and secure fit. The lightweight earbuds sit comfortably in your ears for extended listening sessions, and the intuitive controls make it easy to adjust volume, skip tracks, and activate Siri.

Battery Life:

The AirPods 4 offer impressive battery life, providing up to 6 hours of listening time on a single charge. The charging case extends the overall battery life to a substantial 30 hours, ensuring that you can enjoy your music throughout the day without worrying about running out of power.

Additional Features:

The AirPods 4 come equipped with a range of convenient features, including Spatial Audio with dynamic head tracking for an immersive listening experience, Adaptive EQ for personalized sound, and IPX4 water resistance for worry-free use in various conditions.

Overall:

The Apple AirPods (4th Generation) with ANC are a fantastic choice for anyone seeking a premium pair of wireless earbuds. They offer excellent sound quality, comfortable fit, long battery life, and a host of useful features. If you're an Apple user looking for a seamless audio experience, these earbuds are definitely worth considering.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2024

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Best earphones I’ve ever used.
reviewText:
These are the best earphones I’ve ever had. And to be honest, they’re up there with some of the best headphones I’ve ever had. The noise cancellation is really really good. The transparency mode works well. The adaptive noise filter works well. The conversation detect works well. The sound quality from these headphones is fantastic. I had the third generation AirPods and I loved them. But these are better in every way and fit in my ears even better. I can wear these for a longer time before my ears start to feel funny. Also, they just have a better fit for me. I have zero complaints about these headphones. The craziest part to me is how much more beautiful so many songs sound. Songs that I’ve listened to hundreds of times before. But with these AirPods, I swear I hear notes and tones and instruments that I never noticed before in many songs. Especially some of the grunge, post grunge, and alternative rock songs from the mid 90s. Listening to Anna Molly by Incubus in these things was intense haha.

I hate rubber / silicone tips so I could never use the Pro versions. I’m amazed that these have noise cancellation without the nibs. It’s seriously stellar.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2025

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars
 impressive features, okay value
reviewText:
First, the sound quality is fantastic. The bass is punchy, and the mids and highs are clear and balanced. I’ve used them for everything from music to podcasts, and they perform really well in both scenarios. The addition of Adaptive Audio really helps customize the listening experience depending on your environment, whether you’re in a noisy area or a quiet space. Transparency Mode is another feature I enjoy—it allows you to hear your surroundings while still listening to music, which is really useful when I’m out walking or running errands.

Active Noise Cancellation (ANC) works well, though I wouldn’t say it’s as strong as some of the top-tier over-ear headphones I’ve used. It does a good job of blocking out typical ambient noise, but in environments like crowded cafes or airplanes, you may still hear some background sounds. That said, for day-to-day use, it’s definitely a solid ANC experience.

The Personalized Spatial Audio feature is neat, especially for movies or shows. It creates a more immersive experience, as if the sound is coming from around you. It’s not something I use all the time, but when I do, it adds an extra layer of depth to the audio.

The fit of the AirPods 4 is comfortable, and I appreciate that they come with different ear tips to help get a better seal. They’re also lightweight, which makes them great for long listening sessions. The battery life is impressive too, easily lasting through a few hours of use before needing a recharge. The new USB-C charging case is a great update, making it much easier to charge them with the same cable I use for my other devices. The wireless charging feature is also super convenient.

That said, while these AirPods perform excellently in terms of sound quality, comfort, and convenience, I do feel like the price tag might be a bit high for some. I’ve used other wireless earbuds with similar features, and they’re often more affordable. While you’re definitely getting quality here, the premium price might not feel entirely justified for some users.

In the end, I would definitely recommend these to anyone who’s an Apple ecosystem user or someone looking for high-quality wireless earbuds. However, if you’re on a budget or don’t need all the high-end features, there are alternatives out there that offer a similar experience at a lower price point.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2024

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    A worthy upgrade to the classic AirPod
reviewText: I can’t get over how well the noise cancellation works—It’s magic! If you’ve had AirPods in the past you will love these. I was a bit concerned that the newer shape wouldn’t be as comfortable as the original, but I’ve had no issues with it at all. Like any Apple product, it plays well with other Apple products. Set up is instantaneous and there are a good amount of options for spacial audio and you can change the noise cancellation anytime from the control center. Like I said if you’ve been happy with earlier AirPods models, this is a no-brainer!

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    One of my best tech purchases!

Now when I travel by commuter rail, subway, go to the gym, walk near a busy street, the noise cancellation drowns everything out and I can hear music or whatever else I have on much better. Sometimes I just put the AirPods 4 in just for the noise cancellation but not play any music or anything. And second, the sound is much better than AirPods 3, base very strong. reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great Airpods
reviewText: I recently upgraded to the AirPods 4, and I couldn’t be more impressed. These have quickly become my go-to headphones for daily use. Here’s what I love about them:Sound Quality: The audio is crisp and clear, with a surprising amount of bass for such small earbuds. Whether I’m listening to music, podcasts, or taking calls, the sound is always rich and well-balanced.Comfort and Fit: I was initially concerned about the fit, as I have slightly smaller ears, but these AirPods are surprisingly comfortable. They sit securely without feeling too tight, and I can wear them for hours without discomfort.Battery Life: The battery life is outstanding. I get about 6 hours of listening time on a full charge, and the charging case gives me multiple recharges throughout the day. It’s also super easy to charge with the Lightning port or wireless charging.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2025

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Exactly as expected! (A subjective review, duh)
reviewText: I never take the time to write reviews because why spend so much time on something that will ultimately have no effect on my life? Well in this case, these Airpods have met and exceeded every single one of my expectations and I figured that was worth writing about.Important disclaimers:- OF COURSE this is a subjective opinion, because that is all a review is. Take it with a grain of salt.- Different products work better or worse for different people, it's just that simple.- When talking about noise cancelling headphones, it's important to consider them for what they are, not what we think they SHOULD be.THE FIT:OKAY. I am someone who has very small ear cannals. I have spent years trying to find earbuds that fit my ears comfortably. Silicone in-ear tips have always been extremely uncomfortable for me. That being said, I did own the first gen Airpods Pro for a couple of years before buying these Airpods 4. I wanted earbuds that I could exercise with, use for commuting, and use for blocking out sound when I'm at school or on an airplane. The airpods pro fit the bill, but I could only wear them for short periods of time before they would start to seriously hurt. On top of that, they would always slowly come out of my ears. It didn't matter what size of eartips I used. My ears are just NOT made for in-ear silicone tips. BUT THESE AIRPODS 4!!! Holy smokes they are so comfortable. They never fall out. I can wear them for hours at a time and not even notice them. I haven't worn a pair of Airpods this comfortable since the gen 2 Airpods. The 3's didn't work for me either, but somehow apple really cooked up the ideal fit for these Airpods 4.THE NOISE CANCELLATION:Okay. Obviously, these are NOT going to have the same level of noise reduction as in-ear earbuds because there is no seal created by any silicone tips. If Airpods Pros and silicone tips have always worked for you, just buy those. However, considering that the noise cancellation in these Airpods is ALL driven by software, I have been extremely impressed with the results. It reduces the white noise of annoying sounds like public trains, airplanes, etc. very effectively. While voices and other louder sounds aren't cancelled completely, when music is playing through the earbuds these noises are quite enough to hardly notice. For me, that's enough. I don't need complete silence, I have my over-ear noise cancelling headphones for that.THE SOUND QUALITY:When I say that I was blown away the first time I listened to music on these Airpods, I was NOT kidding. The amount of bass that they managed to pack in to such small, open-eared earbuds is frankly impressive. The sound profile allows for an incredible listening experience no matter what genre of music you listen to (I listen to a wide range of pop, folk, indie, and rap primarily).THE OVERALL VERDICT:These Airpods 4 with Active Noise Cancellation are exactly as I expected them to be. They fit extremely well, the ANC is very acceptable for what they are, and they sound amazing. That's not to mention the TINY case that they come in, making them so easy to slip anywhere. I have been looking for a solid pair of earbuds with ANC that work with my ears for the longest time now. I'm happy to say that these are everything I've ever wanted. If you have had issues with silicone ear-tip earbuds fitting you properly, then these are definitely worth a shot!
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2024

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Really nice headphones but not as comfortable as the old model
reviewText: I've had a pair of AirPods 2 since 2019 and use them daily to listen to audiobooks while I am doing busy work around the house or to use my phone with VoiceOver as I am visually impaired and don't want to bother other people while my phone is reading everything to me.  I figured it was time to upgrade and try out the new AirPods 4 due to some of the new features I wanted.The biggest feature I wanted was a Find My speaker built in.  I had  lost the case ofr my current AirPods a few times and ended up attaching an AirTag to them inside an airtag case.  THis was bulky and made it awkward to keep them in my pocket.  Being able to play a sound without an extra accessory attached is huge.I also like the wireless charging and USB-C compatibility.  I have wireless chargers near my bed and on my desk where I work so I can pop them on anytime.  The internal magent also makes them stay in place kind of like an Apple Watch.The sound is really good.  An improvement over the previous ones but maybe a little more heavy on the low-end, so everything sounds a litle different with these.I like the spatial audio ability and hopefully will find a reason to use it soon.  I have some audiobooks that offer it, but I don't really care if the narrators voice changes with my head motion.  Hopefully I'll find some concerts or something that make it feel like I am in a concert hall or something.I am a little torn on the squeeze button on the stem.  I like being able to perform more actions than I could with a double tap of the old model, but if my hands are full or dirty, I can't just smack them with the back of my hand to activate the actions.  Being able to answer or decline calls or confirm Siri actions with a head shakle or nod is nice and maybe they will extend that to include customizeable head gestures so I can do things like play or pause music/books.The ANC and transparency modes are cool.  I usually leave them in transparency mode and only use ANC if I am doing something like vacuuming.The biggest issue I have with these is that they are not as comfortable as the AirPods 2.  Those I could put in my ear and quite literallyu forget they were there.  These are a little larger and go in deeper so if you do not place them precisely, they do cause a bit of discomfort.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great deal on used one
reviewText: I was able to find a deal of 130. There are few marks but It really don’t bother me. The find my app doesn’t not show AirPods! Will check with Apple Store tomorrow.**AirPods 4 Review**1. **Sound** – I’m not expecting exceptional sound quality from AirPods. I choose them for the Apple ecosystem. The sound isn’t bad, but it doesn’t quite match competitors like the Bose Ultra. However, with Bose, you lose the seamless integration of the Apple ecosystem.2. **Noise Canceling (Compared to AirPods Pro 2)** – Most agree that the AirPods Pro 2 offer the best noise cancellation. However, I’ve noticed a persistent hissing sound with the AirPods Pro 2 that really bothers my ears. Surprisingly, I haven’t seen other users or reviewers mention this – they often just say their ears hurt after wearing them for a long time. I believe the hissing sound is the cause, which is one reason I prefer the AirPods 4 over the AirPods Pro 2. While the AirPods 4 have less effective active noise cancellation, the hissing issue is noticeably reduced.3. **Fit** – Some may dislike the looser fit of the AirPods 4, but I find it beneficial for long-term wear and overall ear health.

reviewText: These AirPods 4 w/ ANC are nice. The sound quality is quite good.I caught a sale and decided to pull the trigger to replace my original AirPods that were getting long in the tooth.I thought the active noise cancellation would be a gimmick, but it’s quite nice and adaptive mode is pretty smart deciding when to turn it on. It’ll cancel out about 90% of the noise from the dryer and the stove exhaust fan.I was a little worried about ear fit since that can be touch and go with the style earbud that rests on the outside of the ear. It seems fine so far. I wouldn’t go jogging while wearing them, but I think they’ll stay in place for a light activity. The trick is to put them in with the stem facing down and then rotate them with the stem facing forward about 45°. That sort of secures them in place in the ear like a little key.I’m also happy with the case. The wireless charging is a nice addition. I can use my Apple Watch charger, a regular wireless charger, or USB-C.My original AirPods died at 13 months, just outside of warranty, and it was a big old pain to get them fixed. Given that experience, I went with the extended AppleCare plus coverage on these. It activated automatically the day the new AirPods arrived at my house.

reviewTitle:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Useful but buggy
reviewText: It's hard to trash Airpods after having spent years using wired earbuds or early (failed) attempts at Bluetooth headphones.  Most of the time, Airpods work very well and have the least issues out of other similar products I've used.The 4th generation of Airpods do seem to have issues in contrast to the earlier versions.  Unlike other reviews, I don't have problems with them falling out.  I do find them to be unusually buggy, and increasingly so.  It seems to get worse the older the Airpods get.  They desync more frequently than older versions, the left one spontaneously disconnects and won't reconnect until putting it back in the case first (on a full charge), and sometimes there's this weird interference effect that causes crackling and can only be resolved by putting the Airpods back in their case and taking them back out again.I'll continue using these until I need to buy new ones, but I really have to wonder whether anyone at Apple actually tested this version for more than a few minutes.  And no, my issues aren't caused by the host device; these problems occur across different Apple devices and my Android phone.  There's no difference.  It's the Airpods that are the problem.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2025

reviewTitle:

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 These Are a Good Option
reviewText:
I’ve tried several hearing aid substitutes over the years, my past favorite being the now unavailable Bose Hearphones and costing $500. Rather than just a sound amplifier, these had several functions allowing you to filter and focus sounds in various ways and for various situations. They were pretty good.

But now Apple has added some great features to their AirPods 2—features that function like far more expensive hearing aids and at less than half the price of the Bose product. I’ve owned these for a month or so and am now just getting the hang of how to use them. If there is a downside to these earbuds it is the rather deep and confusing tech included in them (or, at least confusing for a grandfatherly type like me). Once they are Bluetooth connected to your iPhone (They connect very easily with the button on the front of the EarPod’s charging case.) they should automatically connect every time you put them in your ears. You will then be able to access all the functions by tapping the “settings” app on your phone. You will find a heading near the top of the list just below the box with your name and iCloud options. Tapping on this will allow you to drill down through several pages of options. There are a lot of options there and it can be confusing, but experimenting with the various functions will help you figure out their purpose.

The key here is to drill down to find the hearing test. This will quickly test for hearing loss by leading you through a series of tones of varying in pitch and volume. The end result will be an audiogram that can be used to program your EarPods as hearing aids. As stated before, it took me several weeks to find and activate this feature, but when I did a whole new experience dawned. Just be patient and search around for this function. It works very well.

Of course, these things also serve as EarPods to listen to music or podcasts. (May I recommend “Pat Gray Unleashed!” if your bent is conservative commentary and just plain fooling around). The quality of sound is phenomenal and the buds are more comfortable than most to keep in your ears for an extended time. To control the volume for this function you can TRY to use the external control buttons located on those silly looking stems that hang out of your ears (good luck) OR just open the “Control Center” page (slide one finger upward on your iPhone screen to access this page) where you’ll find the volume slider. If your EarPods are connected and in your ears you’ll see the slider is marked as controlling the AirPods.

I really like these things now that I’m a little more familiar with them. The quality and value are exquisite. If I discover more, I’ll edit this comment.

4 MONTHS LATER: Apple has improved the controls for these in their latest iOS update. The functions I had to dig around to find are now more easily accessed. Getting to the hearing test is now fairly straight forward.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2024

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Gold Standard Earbuds
reviewText:
I’ve had my AirPods Pro Gen 1 for a while, and they were absolutely amazing—until I accidentally sent them through the washer (oops!). I tried going the budget-friendly route and picked up a pair of SoundCore earbuds, but after a short time, I quickly remembered why AirPods are the standard. I returned the SoundCores and grabbed the Gen 2s, and I couldn’t be happier!

These earbuds are incredible. The setup is super user-friendly, and they fit perfectly thanks to the three different tip sizes, ensuring a snug, comfortable fit that stays in place even during workouts. The audio quality is top-notch—clear, rich sound that really stands out. The noise cancellation is a game-changer too; it’s so effective that I can block out the world, whether I’m at the gym, on a plane, or just trying to focus at home. The battery life is great. I use these buds daily and only need to charge them every other week or so. The design is sleek and clean and you can now control the volume using Siri or by sliding your fingers over the stem.

I use them daily for workouts, frequent phone calls, and even travel. I can’t recommend them enough. If you’re looking for premium, reliable earbuds that just work, the AirPods Pro Gen 2 are totally worth the investment. I love these things—hands down my favorite tech purchase!
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2025

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 READ BEFORE PURCHASE! 😊
reviewText:
First, please comment if you have any questions and I would love to respond to help!

I had the AirPods Pro Gen1 prior to these, but the new AirPods blew them out of the water. The added ear tips make customability even better especially for small ears like mine.

The Active Noise Cancellation is clearly superior to the first generation and the addition of Adaptive audio is super cool and very useful.

The battery is even better than I was expecting. The AirPods charge super fast in the case, and the case charging itself is also super fast. The USB-C cord is a very nice addition especially with the new, more common, USB-C charging block. The new Apple Braided USB-C cord is also a small but nice touch.

I personally do not use the ring on the side, but I imagine many people may find it useful. The addition of the Find My capabilities with both the case and the AirPods themselves is beyond helpful because I always seem to misplace them. Small bonus, every time you charge the case or the AirPods, the case sounds off a little chime to let you know that they are charging or if the battery is low.

As an owner of the AirPods Max and a former owner of the AirPods Pro gen 1, I would 100% recommend this new generation. The noise cancellation is superior to the gen 1, but slightly behind the Maxes because they are in-ear instead of over-ear. If you want the maxes, I would get them, but it depends on your activities. I have noticed recently how good the sound quality is. It’s stunning. Sometimes I still prefer my Maxes for certain listening experiences or if I’m heavily invested in a movie or I have a long flight, but the quality on the 2nd gen pros is so crisp. Some pitches you can notice are superior to that of the Maxes. In terms of listen, Maxes win, but it’s so damn close. AirPods Pro are ideal because they are small, discrete, and light weight. You can slip them in your pocket or place just one in your ear. They are also very useful and comfortable to use while working out, as opposed to the maxes.

The AirPods are quite durable too. If my first pair is any indication to this pair, then I promise you, they can take a beating. After 4 years of having the first gen AirPods Pro, I have thrown them around, dropped them hundreds of times and they often got small scratches, but only chipped once or twice after higher falls on super hard surfaces. But they worked every single time.

Long story short, if you’re on the fence, get them. They are super great for travel, workouts/runs, house chores, and all activities in general.

Hope you find this helpful, if you have any questions please comment them!
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2024

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 These are fantastic! First pair of AirPods. I use the hearing aid functionality
reviewText:
A couple months ago I got “commercial” hearing aids from the VA. However, I didn’t like how they operated so I gave them back, and they’re going to order a different brand/model, which I’ll have in about three months (!) So I went in search of quality, inexpensive hearing aids to fill the gap. (My hearing loss is considered mild, at -32db on one side and -39db on the other.) I got the AirPods last Friday, and the software for hearing aid support rolled out last night (iOS 18.1) So this will be a two part review.

Part one is the overall operation as earbuds for music and calls. These are my first ever Apple branded sound devices. Once I got the correct tips installed and the buds fitted, I was ready to go. OMG! The sound quality overall is the best of any earbuds I’ve ever owned, and by a huge margin. Astonishing bass, and crisp high range. (My hearing loss is in the upper ranges.) I’m beyond happy. Overall, the only thing I’m dissatisfied with is the battery life at 5-6 hours, but the extremely fast recharge speed eases that compliant. Voice quality when on a call is crystal clear. Controls are easy, though a bit hard to operate considering how small they are.

Part two is the hearing aid function. The first thing I had to do was take a hearing test with the included software. (However, if you prefer to use a third party hearing test, you can import that profile and use it.) The hearing test takes about 5 minutes, after which the hearing aid sound enhancement profile is set automatically and they start up. I was totally gobsmacked at how well these things work! They boost the exact freqs I need. They actually work considerably better than those $7000 (egads!) hearing aids that I returned.

Now for the ANC. At home, I sit right in front of a large, noisy window air conditioner. On the opposite side of the room is a dehumidifier (I live in south central Texas, where it was 91° yesterday.) Between these two pieces of equipment, it’s pretty noisy here. I turned on ANC and the room went absolutely silent. So silent that I thought I’d popped a circuit breaker and everything had stopped running. I removed one of the AirPods, and the noise returned. Amazing.

In short, everything I’d hoped the commercial hearing aids would do, the AirPods actually DID. I consider this the smartest purchase I’ve made in years. Only one negative, and that’s the ear tips. None of the provided sizes are a good fit for me, so I’m now looking to memory foam replacements. But that’s a very small gripe. If you’re looking at these, either for music or hearing, don’t hesitate. You’ll be glad you got them.

EDIT: I had to go to a doctor appointment across town today. Part of the route is on a toll highway with an 80 mph speed limit and heavy traffic. I got up to speed and turned on noise cancel mode. INSTANTLY the car was completely silent at 80 mph. No road rumble, no engine noise, no wind noise, no traffic noise. It was an amazing and invigorating experience. Oh, for those wondering about recharge time, if you take them all the way down to 0% battery and they shut down (I’ve now ascertained that 6 hours is about what you get with all the options turned on), it only takes about 15 minutes in the charge case and you’ll easily get another 3-4 hours out of them.

EDIT2: Okay, I’ve had these for almost a month, and I just keep liking them more and more. I didn’t mention pairing in my original text above, so I need to mention it here. There is, in effect, no pairing that you need to do, at least in the Apple-verse. By the time I’d opened the charging case and looked at the buds, they’d already paired with both my iPhone and iPad. I didn’t have to go into settings on my iOS devices, or press any buttons on the case. Just open case and it’s done. As a computer engineer for 40 years, I have never seen a faster or more seamless pairing of anything.

One more word on recharging: just today I took them all the way to zero. Dropped them in the charger and in FIVE MINUTES they were at 24%.

I am in love with the hearing aid functionality. I hear sounds in movies that I’d never heard before in my life, even when my hearing was perfect. And I can adjust amplification either by going into settings on my iPhone, or sliding my finger up or down on the stem.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2024

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Very Versatile, Handy and Functional Tech
reviewText:
These Airpods are one of the best purchases I've made in a long time. I wish I had done my research on them sooner. I especially purchased these over cheap earphones because of the Apple hearing aid features. My hearing is pretty bad and these have helped me in several occasions and are very functional. Even if you are not using the hearing aid features (there are a few), the noise cancellation on these is amazing. You can opt to have them adjust to whatever your needs are. All of the settings can be a bit confusing so you do have to play with them a bit to find the adjustments that work for you. However, even this may change depending on what you need them for. Sometimes you need to cancel noise, or listen to music but need to hear other urgent sounds around you, or you may just need them to talk on the phone. I have used these quite a bit over the last 5 months and they have been very reliable. I never have connection issues with my phone or microphone issues.
I like that Apple does updates on these, just like their other products. I am amazed at this technology especially for its tiny size and I wish I had gotten these a lot sooner.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2025

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars
 Cheap Alternative to Casual Heaaring Problems
reviewText: In 2023 I got tested by an audiologist and was diagnosed with mild to moderate hearing loss, and offered hearing aids for $3,000. I then started doing research on OTC hearing aids which became available in late 2023. The reviews revealed a wide range of personal reviews of usage with both quality and price. Being retired and rarely in social environments my hearing problems were at home with my spouse on daily basis, and family occasionally. I really didn't want to commit thousands for aids I would not use while awake .All the reviews had problems with even the best rated aids. When IOS 18.1 was announced with the hearing aid option I considered buying the Airpods, since my old Earbuds were defunct. I bought a pair, took the fit and hearing test, which confirmed my mild and moderate hearing loss. Reviews of the Airpods, had two cons, the stigma of wearing in public while conversing and 5-6 hours of use before recharging. The first week I wore them in public and didn't detect any bad feedback. They are everything they claim to be. Control with iPhone app is easy to use and the four modes of hearing optiions, Off, Transparency, Adaptive, and Noise Cancellation work as expected. The first day I heard things in my house I haven't heard in 20 years! I can now hear my wifes tiny voice, even from another room. I don't need them for TV, so I rarely have them on for more than six hours. Put in the charging case, they recharge to 100% in less than hour. I have only two cons; they can fall out, even if you pass the fit test, and one of the pods chirps occasionally while inserted. For someone who needs excellent hearing assistance in a casual or intermittent setting and doesn't want to spend hundreds or thousands, I highly recommend these. Plus, Apple will probably add improvements in the future.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2024

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 solid
reviewText:
Here is my take

Apple AirPods have become synonymous with wireless earbuds, and for good reason. Their seamless integration with Apple devices is truly unmatched. Pairing is a breeze, and the audio switching between devices like iPhones, iPads, and Macs is incredibly smooth. The sound quality is decent for everyday listening, with a focus on clarity and a balanced sound profile.

Pros:

Seamless Apple Ecosystem Integration: This is the biggest selling point. Pairing is effortless, and switching between devices is incredibly smooth.
Comfortable Fit: The AirPods generally fit comfortably for most people.
Intuitive Controls: The tap controls are easy to learn and use.
Good Call Quality: The built-in microphones offer decent call quality.
Stylish and Discreet: The AirPods have a minimalist and stylish design.
Cons:

Price: The AirPods are significantly more expensive than many comparable earbuds from other brands.
Sound Quality: While decent, the sound quality isn't exceptional. Bass can be lacking, and the soundstage can feel somewhat limited.
Limited Customization: Customization options for sound are limited compared to some competitors.
Durability: Some users have reported durability issues, particularly with the stems.
Fit Issues: Not everyone finds the AirPods comfortable, and they may fall out for some.
Overall:

The Apple AirPods are a premium product with a premium price tag. If you're deeply invested in the Apple ecosystem and prioritize seamless integration and ease of use, the AirPods are an excellent choice. However, if sound quality is your top priority or you're on a budget, there are more affordable and potentially better-sounding options available.

Recommendation:

Highly recommended for: Apple users who prioritize seamless integration and ease of use within the Apple ecosystem.
Consider alternatives if: Sound quality is your top priority, you're on a budget, or you're concerned about durability.

I hope this review is helpful!
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2025

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Fantastic headphones for users of apple products
reviewText:
I love and own many apple devices and bought the AirPods Pro specifically because of integration with my iPhone, iPad, MacBook Pro and Apple TV. The integration is really nice - the devices paired seamlessly when I purchased the headphones and it has been trivial to switch from one device to another. The headphones are beautifully designed and look and feel like a premium product, as you'd expect from Apple. They sound really good when listening to music and television, and call quality when paired to an iPhone is fantastic. I assume that the microphone quality is good as I've used these headphones for many work calls and am yet to receive any negative feedback. Sound cancellation is also fantastic.

The AirPods hold a good charge and I recently used them without issue for 4 hours straight on a transatlantic flight. Charging them is as simple as popping them into their case and the case itself can be charged via USB-C or, as I prefer, via MagSafe. I didn't like the look of these headphones when they first came out but guess I've become acclimatized seeing people wear them daily and no longer have any issue.

There are two issues that may impact one's opinion of this product. Firstly, I've heard complaints from multiple people that none of the buds that come with the device fit comfortably in their ears. I did not encounter this issue myself but my wife, who also purchased the headset, and the wife of a friend both felt discomfort when using the AirPods. Perhaps smaller ears are an issue?

Secondly, the AirPods can only be paired with another device via the case. Most of the time this isn't a problem but I we are my AirPods to the gym and don't normally bring my case. Most treadmills, ellipticals, etc. in shared settings retain devices (and other information) only for that session and I find that every time I want to use gym equipment I need to repair - meaning that I have to have the case with me. Ideally I'd be able to hold down a button on one of the AirPods and pair that way. This certainly isn't a dealbreaker for me, and likely won't be for most people, but it's a minor annoyance that detracts a little from an otherwise stellar product.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2025

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Great for everyday audio
reviewText:
The Apple AirPods Pro (2nd Generation) are a premium pair of true wireless earbuds that offer superior noise cancellation, enhanced sound quality, and improved battery life over the previous model. With the H2 chip, Adaptive Transparency, and Personalized Spatial Audio, Apple has refined the listening experience while maintaining the signature AirPods convenience.

Pros & Cons

✅ Pros:
• Excellent Active Noise Cancellation (ANC) with the new H2 chip
• Rich, detailed sound with enhanced bass and clarity
• Adaptive Transparency Mode lets in important sounds while reducing harsh noise
• Improved battery life (Up to 6 hours per charge, 30 hours with case)
• Find My integration for both the case and earbuds
• New USB-C charging case (latest version) with built-in speaker and lanyard loop
• Personalized Spatial Audio with dynamic head tracking
• Touch controls on stems for volume adjustments

❌ Cons:
• Expensive compared to competitors
• No support for high-resolution audio codecs (LDAC, aptX)
• Still white-only design (no color options)
• Silicone tips may not fit all ears perfectly

Design & Comfort

Apple sticks with its minimalist white design, but the AirPods Pro 2 are slightly tweaked for better ergonomics and stability. The four included ear tip sizes (XS, S, M, L) allow for a more customized fit, making them comfortable for extended wear.

The MagSafe charging case now has a built-in speaker for better Find My alerts, a lanyard loop, and USB-C charging (for the latest version).

Sound Quality

The AirPods Pro 2 deliver crisp highs, balanced mids, and deeper bass compared to the first-gen model. The H2 chip enhances audio processing, making sound richer and more immersive.

Key Features:
• Adaptive EQ fine-tunes music in real time.
• Personalized Spatial Audio creates a theater-like 360° experience.
• Bass is punchier without overpowering vocals.

While the sound is fantastic, audiophiles may miss high-resolution codec support like aptX or LDAC.

Active Noise Cancellation & Transparency Mode
• ANC is 2x better than the original AirPods Pro, making them among the best noise-canceling earbuds.
• Adaptive Transparency Mode intelligently reduces sudden loud noises while keeping voices and ambient sound clear.

Whether you’re in a busy city, on a plane, or at the gym, the AirPods Pro 2 handle noise exceptionally well.

Battery Life & Charging
• Up to 6 hours of listening time with ANC on (vs. 4.5 hours in the original AirPods Pro).
• Up to 30 hours total with the MagSafe charging case.
• USB-C, MagSafe, and Apple Watch charger compatibility (for the newest model).

Battery life is solid, but some competitors like the Sony WF-1000XM5 offer longer playtime.

Connectivity & Features
• Seamless Apple ecosystem integration (iPhone, iPad, Mac, Apple Watch).
• Bluetooth 5.3 for better stability and efficiency.
• Audio Sharing lets you connect two pairs of AirPods to one device.
• Siri voice control for hands-free use.

Android users can use them, but they’ll miss features like auto-switching, spatial audio, and Find My tracking.

Final Verdict

The AirPods Pro (2nd Gen) are an outstanding choice for Apple users looking for top-tier noise cancellation, improved sound quality, and seamless integration with their devices. While pricey, they deliver a premium audio experience with strong ANC, spatial audio, and deep Apple ecosystem connectivity.

⭐ Rating: 9/10 ⭐

Best For:
✅ Apple users who want the best wireless earbuds for iPhones
✅ Commuters and travelers needing top-tier noise cancellation
✅ Those who love Spatial Audio for immersive sound

Consider Alternatives If:
❌ You need hi-res audio support (Sony WF-1000XM5, Bose QuietComfort Earbuds II)
❌ You’re an Android user (Samsung Galaxy Buds2 Pro may be better)
❌ You want a cheaper pair of noise-canceling earbuds
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2025

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars
 Big Improvement over 1st Gen, not so sure they are hearing aids
reviewText:
I was fairly satisfied with my first generation AirPods Pro, having bought them several years ago mostly for use when working out. When Apple announced the addition of hearing aids features, I thought it was a good excuse to upgrade. And it would be one less lightning connector I'd have to contend with. This review is written for those of you who are considering upgrading.

I bought these prior to the release of iOS 18.1. The setup was the same as before, find comfortable rubbers, run the test that plays the little tune and that's it. With iOS 18.0 the sound didn't seem much better over Gen 1 AirPods Pro, but the noise cancellation was an improvement. However, with the update to 18.1 there's a big change. There's now a hearing assistance screen where you toggle on hearing aids. You're prompted to take a hearing test. This test is similar to hearing tests you might have had in school or at a doctors' office where tones of differing pitch and loudness are played and you tap a button on the screen when you hear it. It takes about 10 minutes or so. The phone/earbuds then produce a profile based on your test results. You can also take the report to an audiologist (the report is in the Health app), although I'm not all that sure they'd bother to review it.

Once you've done a hearing test the hearing aid is enabled. You can then make adjustments to the default settings. I found the default setting to have far too much high end for my liking and too much gain as well. But then again maybe I'm just used to being half-deaf. 😉 I did discover I have a device with a bad fan though, so maybe that's a good thing. I don't seem to get any squealing or feedback when using the hearing aid feature but I've only used it a few times. It did come in handy when at a meeting with a quiet talker speaking, boosting up the sound made it much easier to listen. But ultimately I'd say the hearing aid function is a gimmick. If you're really worried about hearing loss, go to an audiologist.

However, there is one thing that going through the hearing test and setting up hearing assistance does improve and that's the playback of music. Because it is able to adjust EQ to match your hearing profile there's a drastic improvement in how good the AirPods sound. I'd put them on par with my Bose QC-3 headset now, maybe even slightly better (Bose still has much better noise cancellation of course). Adaptive noise cancellation works but tends to be little too aggressive, so I just use full cancellation. The personalized volume and conversation awareness functions are also a little too touchy and seem to be constantly changing the volume control in response to false alarms. I'm sure they'll get better over time but for now I wouldn't say they're a reason to switch.

They also have the same problems connecting to whatever random device happens to grab them. I work out with my Watch but leave my phone at home. So if I start playing a podcast or music in my driveway it will originate from my iPhone, even if I'm using my watch to initiate the media. It is getting slightly better in that eventually the AirPods will abandon the iPhone then connect to the Watch (I used to have to pull them out of my ears, wait a few seconds then try to start playback on the watch), but there's still a gap of a few annoying seconds while they sort things out. Again, not the end of the world, but seems like a solvable problem.

If you're hoping to get budget hearing aids, look elsewhere. I can't imagine wearing these for 12-16 hours a day. I'm not so sure the batteries will last that long anyway. Besides, you're wearing earbuds, so people probably won't realize you're using them in hearing aid mode. And let's all admit it, they look kind of dorky.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2024

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Unbelievably helpful for mild hearing loss
reviewText: I had my hearing checked a few years ago by COSTCO and it revealed that I had mild hearing loss. It was a toss up as to whether I might need hearing aids but I felt my hearing was adequate at this stage of my life. I was retired and not doing a lot of socializing. Just recently I had a hearing test done by Miracle Ear. After my test they strongly recommended that I get their hearing aids and could even try them out before I purchased them. The options were a good, better, best solution which was confusing as to their value. Also charging them and maintaining them seemed like they would be more trouble than they were worth. BTW they were very expensive even with the huge price discount offered so I declined. Once again I felt my hearing was adequate for my present retirement. During the morning of the President’s day sale I ordered some Apple air pod pro 2’s. Amazon delivered them that day. I took the hearing test that revealed I had “mild” hearing loss in both of my ears.  I then turned on the hearing aid function and voila what a difference. Could now hear my wife when she was in every room of our home. No longer needed closed caption on the tv and XM radio never sounded better. So for my mild hearing loss the air pod pro 2’s are incredible. Now to try and get my wife to buy a pair for herself.  Ha! Ha!

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    I LIVE, I LISTEN, I TRANSCEND!
reviewText: I LIVE, I LISTEN, I TRANSCEND! These AirPods Pro 2 are the VOICE of the V8 Gods themselves! When I ride into battle, the roar of the engines and the wails of the damned cannot pierce the sacred dome of Active Noise Cancellation—it silences the wasteland and leaves only the sound of my WAR DRUMS (or Spotify).TRANSPARENCY MODE? A true gift from Valhalla. When the war party calls, I hear every whisper, every screech of tire, every rev of the sacred machines—no need to remove these blessed ear-gems. Personalized Spatial Audio makes it feel as though the war cries are all around me. My enemies approach? I hear them before they strike. My Immortan speaks? His voice echoes as if from the Citadel itself!USB-C Charging? As convenient as guzzoline in a full tank—swift and powerful. And the H2 Chip? It is the blood of the device, pulsing with the energy of a thousand revving engines. The fit is divine, like a chrome mask sealing me to my fate—tight and secure even in the chaos of battle!I shall ride eternal, listening to the sounds of glory, bass deep as the desert canyons, treble sharp as war rigs tearing through the dunes. This is the tech of the ascended, the audio of the chosen.WITNESS ME!
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2025

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great, but…
reviewText: I use these primarily for noise cancellation features, as I have misophonia and hate hearing trigger sounds.Initially, I was going to return these because the sound cancellation let sound in, unlike my 1st gens!UNTIL— I noticed, due to the design of the ear tips themselves, they allow more sound in compared to the AirPod Pro 1st Gen.At first glance, both tips look the same. But they are not! The 1st Gen are more “circular”, and the 2nd is more “oval” or condensed like a “pill” shape. My ear hole is a circle, not a pill shape, lol, so it didn’t seal all the way.I tested that theory by placing my 1st Gen ear tips on the 2nd Gen. Viola! They’re much better than the 1st ones now, and I no longer want to return them!Also—I don’t hear my pulse/heartbeat in my ears with these ones like I did with the 1st Gen, which is a major upgrade because I HATE the sound of a heartbeat. Just pure, almost blissful silence. Unfortunately… these do not turn off the ringing in ears, hah.Also—the “background sound” feature (which is like a sound machine built into iPhones) via accessibility setting on the iPhone are amazing through these airpods.Long story short, these are amazing for misophoniacs.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Very happy with these Airpod Pro 2nd Gen
reviewText: These were priced with a great discount so I grabbed them and got same day delivery with Prime. They were simple to pair to my iPhone 16 and had a 60% charge right out of the box. The sound quality is excellent. I hear detail with these that I miss with more expensive Bose & Sennheiser HP's. They are comfortable and have a test mode for best fit. It will recommend the best size cups (they come with 5 total sizes). They have a hearing test mode and I was surprised that even at my age (I'm a senior) it said my hearing is normal. It shows you a plot of your hearing for anyone who want to know the details. If your hearing tests deficient they provide some form of hearing aid assist but it's only available if your hearing fails the test. In addition to the ANC (which is very good) they have a Transparency mode that allows you to hear sounds around you without sacrificing quality. I'm very happy with this purchase and will get a lot of use from these. I haven't tried them yet with my Mac Mini or on phone calls but I'm sure they'll work great. One thing to note: to get the new features (hearing test etc) you must have IOS version 18 or higher.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    If you are on the fence, take the leap, trust me.
reviewText: I always talked bad about wireless earbuds but wow these are incredible. The sound quality is awesome, the noise canceling is akin to turning off everything around you, if it's super noisy around you high peaks like claps and snaps might leak through but it's hardly noticeable when there is music playing. The controls are easy to use, responsive and work surprisingly well. Not sure how the experience compares on non ios devices, however with the brief playing around with it, the extra capabilities with ios are incredible, the background sounds feature is awesome for reading/relaxing you don't get distracted by outside noise due to noise cancelation and the stock noise options are very calming and let you focus well (I prefer this to using them with no noise as the cancelation is so good the clicking of your teeth and breathing are very noticeable). The remote listening is sneaky and I will be playing more with it, I have a 15 pro max so the mic is very good so I can whisper across the room from my phone with 2 fans on and hear myself clear as day, but experience may be different with older models with less adept microphones. The hearing aid mode is also awesome and with no experience with traditional hearing aids myself I can't compare but for mild/moderate hearing loss I would say these would be perfectly acceptable. Overall I am shocked at how great these are, it's rare to buy something and be blown out of the water with the quality. If I lost these things I would buy another in a heartbeat(unlikely as they have airtag built in lol) 10/10 buy these now you will not be disappointed.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Elevate Your Audio Experience with the Apple AirPods Pro 2!
reviewText: I recently upgraded to the Apple AirPods Pro 2, and they have been a game-changer for my audio experience! These wireless earbuds offer exceptional active noise cancellation (ANC), which effectively blocks out ambient noise, allowing me to focus on my music or calls. The Adaptive Transparency mode is also a great feature, letting me hear my surroundings when needed without compromising on audio quality.The sound quality is outstanding, with rich, well-balanced audio that brings out the best in my favorite tracks. The Personalized Spatial Audio feature creates an immersive listening experience, making it feel like I'm right in the middle of the action. The earbuds are also equipped with a Hearing Aid feature, which is a fantastic addition for those who need it.The fit is comfortable, thanks to the four sizes of silicone tips, ensuring a secure seal in my ears. The battery life is impressive, with up to 6 hours of listening time on a single charge, and the charging case provides multiple additional charges. The seamless integration with other Apple devices is a huge plus, making it easy to switch between my iPhone, iPad, and Mac.Overall, the Apple AirPods Pro 2 have exceeded my expectations in terms of audio quality, noise cancellation, and overall functionality. They are a must-have for anyone looking to elevate their audio experience. Highly recommend them!

    How well the hearing aid works

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great Sound & Noise Cancellation
reviewText: I got these to use on long drives and at work because they are discreet, especially if you have long hair like me. I worked in a factory that had a “ let me see it” and “ we won't ask if you have them” policy with earbuds. So many of the guys wore hoodies, beanies, or just grew long hair. I paired them with my Android and was so impressed with the noise cancellation that I bought an iPhone to unlock more features. I could use one at a time during my long 12-hour shifts or use both with the passthrough on so I could hear the people around me. The quick charge time when in the case made the 30-minute breaks all I needed during the day to keep them working. I do recommend a slim case of some sort to keep them closed if you are clumsy because the small size makes them hard to find if you drop the entire thing and they get lost in a loud environment. The water resistance makes them safe to use in hot weather or workouts. I upgraded to the USB-C case to avoid using multiple cables, but it wasn’t a must since there isn’t any difference in the buds themselves. I recommend them if you have an iPhone and if you have an Android only if you want some small but functional earbuds that are less bulky than the competitors.

reviewTitle:

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    All the positive reviews under these airpods are true!
reviewText: My Fello college students, if you want a short explanation of what to expect, here's what I'd say.The noise cancelling is amazing, it's so advanced to the point that you may get a dizzy sensation the first time you put them in. But you'll get use to it.The music audio is a 10/10. Everything is crisp and fluent.If it doesn't fit you can put in a smaller/bigger earpiece size in (they send you a S/M/L/XL). They each clip onto the airpods through magnetic connection. If you're really sweaty or have a lot of jell in your ear, the airpods may tend to slip out a little bit, but that's an easy fix. Either just wipe your ear down or wipe the airpod off.I personally LOVE bass. These air pods provide a good kick. The mix of advanced noise cancellation + sound quality makes the bass sound super nice. So if you're looking for quality bass sound I'd recommend these air pods, however, if you're looking for bass that will quite literally blast your eardrums out of their sockets, I'd recommend you go checkout Skullcandy headphones.They also have manual features that you can use to change/skip/replay songs.Overall, I'd give these airpod's a 9.5/10 with the only negative being the fact that it may fall out sometimes due to sweat. (But lets be honest, no airpod is going to completely withstand a low ammount of friction due to a liquid without having some other sort of earpiece to keep it in place). Therefore, these are a 10/10!

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Bought for hearing aid feature
reviewText: I’ve owned (and lost) an older set of Air Pods Pro but when the hearing aid feature was announced,  I knew I wanted to at least try them again.I don’t really care for in-ear headphones but I started wearing clinical hearing aids (Jabra Enhance Select 300 $~1500) and while to help and work pretty well, there are a couple things I don’t care for.  1) being inserted into your ear canal, they start to annoy me after a few hours.  2) when in a noisy environment (restaurant, lunch room etc) it is almost worse wearing them.The Air Pods Pro v2 are perfect but have some things that really set them apart.  1) they don’t bother me as much as as the Jabra or at least in the same way.  That’s largely personal preference I’m sure.  2) the background noise setting and conversation enhance are amazing.  Still some room for improvement but when I’m in an overly noisy environment, I would take my Jabra out because it was overwhelming and they were making it worse, not better.  I actually put my Air Pods Pro in when in that same environment.  I can actually hear people across from me.The one other thing that will take some time is that wearing the Air Pods Pro in public or at work looks like you aren’t paying attention.  People don’t even notice when I’m wearing my Jabra.The battery life on the Air Pods Pro is no wear as long as the Jabra but that’s fine for the cost.At the end of the day they are well worth the $200 I paid (on sale) and I expect Apple will continue to improve these over time.
