reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Apple AirPods Pro 2 – A Game-Changing Audio Experience
reviewText: The Apple AirPods Pro 2 are nothing short of exceptional, offering a seamless blend of cutting-edge technology and unparalleled user experience. As a frequent user of wireless earbuds, I am genuinely impressed by the enhancements Apple has introduced in this iteration.Sound Quality & Active Noise CancellationThe sound quality is superb, delivering rich bass, crisp mids, and clear highs. The Active Noise Cancellation (ANC) has been noticeably improved from the previous generation. It effectively blocks out ambient noise, allowing for an immersive listening experience even in noisy environments like public transport or bustling cafes. The Transparency Mode is equally remarkable, enabling you to stay aware of your surroundings without sacrificing sound quality.Innovative Hearing Aid FeatureOne standout feature is the hearing aid functionality. For those with mild hearing difficulties, this feature is a game-changer. The AirPods Pro 2 discreetly amplify sound, providing a subtle yet effective way to enhance hearing in conversations or quiet settings. It’s another example of Apple’s commitment to accessibility.Comfort & DesignThe design remains sleek and minimalistic, but the addition of extra silicone tip sizes ensures a snug and comfortable fit for prolonged use. The lightweight build means you can wear them for hours without discomfort, whether you’re working, exercising, or relaxing.Seamless ConnectivityApple’s proprietary H2 chip ensures a smooth and instantaneous connection to all Apple devices. Switching between my iPhone, iPad, and MacBook is effortless. The Bluetooth range is excellent, maintaining a stable connection even when moving around the house.Battery Life & ChargingBattery life has been extended, offering around 6 hours of continuous playback with ANC on, and over 30 hours with the charging case. The MagSafe and wireless charging capabilities add to the convenience, making recharging hassle-free.Final ThoughtsThe AirPods Pro 2 set a new standard for wireless earbuds. Whether you’re an audiophile, a frequent traveler, or someone who values premium audio accessories, these earbuds are a worthy investment. The combination of high-quality sound, advanced features, and user-centric design makes them a must-have.Highly recommended! 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    You must buy these their perfect
reviewText: I’ve had these AirPods for almost 2 years and let me say that they are the best purchase you will ever make. I’ve never written a review but I had to because of how magnificent these are. The noice cancelling is amazing, for my first test I sat in a chair playing loud music turned away from a piano. I sat and waited, then took one out to tell her to start playing. To my astonishment she had been playing for a while and I didn’t even notice. The transparency mode is amazing as well because you’ll often forget there even in your ears because it plays the sound so well. You can even hear the slightest brush of your fingers it’s like there not even in. They are extremely comfortable and fit perfectly in your ears. They hardly weigh anything but they still have amazing battery life. They are extremely durable and water resistant as well. I had one in my pocket and as I went to get the mail it fell out. An hour later after searching and searching I found it in the road in the snow with tire tracks right over it practically burying it. It took it home thinking it would be completely ruined, but besides worse noice cancelling and a big scratch on the side (which is only cosmetic damage) it works perfectly. And don’t even get me started on the audio quality. I have high quality head phones and these AirPods Pro 2 blow them out of the water and they are extremely portable. The precision find my is also so nice because it also doubles as an AirTag. I put them on my keys and haven’t lost them since. Seriously the best product I’ve ever purchased because I use them hours daily. The only possible downside I could even think of is if you have very large ears, they may not fit great since the tips only go to extra large. Also don’t buy apple care plus. It’s a scam because they are literally indestructible and impossible to lose. Best $250 dollars ever spent would give 10 stars if possible. Seriously besides my phone, which I use to connect with my AirPods, there is nothing I use more than these AirPod pros. Also I exercise in them all the time and unless intentionally trying to knock them out, they’ve never fallen out. Oh yeah and also they are perfect for taking calls as well. And they fit perfectly into the overpriced apple ecosystem.

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Highly-Customizable Audio
reviewText: I was skeptical about these Airpod Pro 2's being an upgrade from the previous version, but I'm happy I ignored my doubts and purchased them during Black Friday for a screamin' deal on a worthy updated bit of hardware.The combination of these Airpods and iOS 18 with my iPhone 15 is great! I wanted to utilize the features for the hearing impaired to share with my husband who struggles to hear me (perhaps sometimes that's his intent...).  While his hearing loss is significant - approximately 80% in both ears - these do help some.  While not a replacement for hearing aids for significant hearing loss, a great option for those with mild loss.I think what I was most impressed by when I first tried these Airpods was their noise-canceling ability. Followed quickly by their transparency mode. Both are equally good and useful.The sound quality is outstanding. I was hearing things in all kinds of music genres (Pop, Rock, Country, Classical) that I had previously missed. There's a depth of sound with nuances that were pleasantly unexpected.Charging is simple via USB-C cable or wireless charging, and effective, with the Airpods lasting on one charge based upon what you're using them for and features enabled. Listening to music, about 5 1/2 hours, but if you add spacial audio to the mix, about 4 1/2 hours. With up to 6 charges of the Airpods per full charge on the case.(Per Google) Here are some other things to know about the AirPods Pro 2 battery life:- A five-minute charge gives you about an hour of battery life- Real-world results may differ from the estimates, which are based on a 50% volume level- To recharge the case, you can put your AirPods back in the case when you're not using them- If you only listen to your AirPods for a few hours a day, you can charge the case every 2 to 3 daysI own Bose and Bowers & Wilkins over-ear phones, which both offer excellent audio quality, but these are by far my favorite. I had previously avoided the AirPods as the fit in my ears was not good, but these Pro 2's fit well and in addition to using them at my desk, I could see using them during workouts without issue.Definitely worth your consideration.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2024

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Apple AirPods Pro 2: A Perfect Companion for Video Editing on MacBook Pro
reviewText: As a video editor, having reliable and high-quality audio equipment is essential. The Apple AirPods Pro 2 have proven to be an excellent choice for my editing needs on my MacBook Pro. Here's why:Superior Sound Quality: The sound quality of the AirPods Pro 2 is outstanding. The earbuds deliver clear, crisp audio with a balanced range of highs, mids, and lows. This is crucial for video editing, as it allows me to hear every detail in the audio tracks, ensuring that my edits are precise and professional.Active Noise Cancellation: The active noise cancellation (ANC) feature is a game-changer. It effectively blocks out background noise, allowing me to focus on my work without distractions. Whether I'm editing in a busy office or a noisy café, the ANC helps create a quiet environment, which is essential for detailed audio work.Comfort and Fit: The AirPods Pro 2 are incredibly comfortable to wear for extended periods. The customizable silicone tips ensure a secure fit, which is important during long editing sessions. I can wear them for hours without experiencing discomfort, making them ideal for marathon editing projects.Seamless Integration with MacBook Pro: One of the best features of the AirPods Pro 2 is their seamless integration with the MacBook Pro. Pairing is effortless, and the connection is stable and reliable. The automatic switching between devices is also a handy feature, allowing me to easily transition from my MacBook to my iPhone when needed.Spatial Audio: The spatial audio feature adds an immersive dimension to my editing experience. It provides a surround sound effect that makes it easier to position audio elements accurately within the mix. This feature is particularly useful when working on projects that require precise audio placement.Battery Life: The battery life of the AirPods Pro 2 is impressive. They last long enough to get through a full day of editing without needing a recharge. The quick charge feature is also convenient, providing several hours of use with just a short charging time.Portability: The compact and portable design of the AirPods Pro 2 makes them easy to carry around. The charging case fits comfortably in my pocket, ensuring that I always have my earbuds with me, ready for any editing task that comes up.Conclusion: Overall, the Apple AirPods Pro 2 Wireless Earbuds have significantly enhanced my video editing workflow on my MacBook Pro. Their superior sound quality, active noise cancellation, and seamless integration make them an invaluable tool for any video editor. If you're looking for high-quality earbuds that can keep up with your editing demands, I highly recommend the AirPods Pro 2.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    These are fantastic ear buds
reviewText: Well first off, I have been an AirPod guy for a while.I have also been a cheap AirPod guy too, meaning I have always bought the basic ones and been pretty happy with them, for the most part. I’m a carpenter and so things get treated a bit rough with me but I have always longed for something a bit better, meaning better quality sound, maybe some noise cancelation and just a better ear bud all around. I really wanted to have that precision “find me app” quality that AirTags have but the older more basic air pods don’t have it. They claimed to but not once did they play a sound and not once could I find them with the find my app, these have the precision locating and also play a loud tone .. but also (see below)Recently I ran my latest AirPods through the washer. Caught it early… but honestly too late, the charging case was full of water and went directly into rice. R.I.P old ear buds.  They didn’t make it , let’s have a moment of silence for them plz…Okay ! So the new AirPod pro 2(second gen) came and I instantly patted myself on the back for opting for the $199 upgrade just to see if all the hype was true.. it is !!The second I put them in my ears, the entire world arround me disappeared. Silence to the point of “is that fan off? Because normally it’s loud AF, thought me, took out the AirPods and yup it was still loud.The noise cancellation is insanely good !!The amazing sound quality of music is just that, amazing, and this little bundle of joy is worth its weight in gold with all of the customizable settings they offer, heck you can even take a pic of your ear and it will tell u what supplied plug covers are best suited for your ear, as well as a sound test option to make sure you are getting every cent out of these.Now I also bought a waterproof/crush proof case, the Catalyse ones you see in pic above so we don’t have anymore washing machine accidents.So the question still remains, is the extra $100 dollars for pro 2’s worth it ?For me that’s a resounding yes.Never would I opt for “refurbished” AirPods.. nothing about that sounds appealing.These should last me at least a couple of years, where as my old basic AirPods might have lasted 6 months. I found that the basic ones sound and stuff diminished rapidlySo “treat yo-self” to the AirPod 2 pros, again I repeat, the second I put them in my ears, I knew I made the right decision.So why don’t you?Get a protective case too, they are amazing.

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Better than my older AirPods with hearing augmentation
reviewText: No surprises since my older iPods  works similarly aside from the new customized hearing augmenting technology. That and a Prime Day price point. My older iPhone 8 only provides usual AirPod listening and dictation but to get the hearing customized I turned to my iPad with the mandatory 18z iOS to create my customization with the hearing test. The 8 only supports iOS to 14.7x. Good excuse to upgrade my 8 to a modest refurbed SE. I don’t need a multi-lens camera and qadzillions of pixels to have a functioning cellphone for goodness sake! The AirPods pro 2 do a nice job but figuring things out with the pitiful picture-ladened leaflet is really cheesy. Even a Q-code to get to the pertinent sections would be nice don’t ya think? Why make it complicated Mr Apple?….If I use these AirPods with other devices I have to re-pair every time and not always the first effort works. Microwave dings are now readily audible but so is the defrost refrig fan - a bit annoying. Hasn’t eliminated the age-related tinnitus. I’m still getting used to wearing them. One ear canal is more sensitive to prolonged wearing. I haven’t worn them past 4+ hrs yet, working up to the 5-6 hrs most reviewers have seen. So, If you’re wearing an older generation AirPod and you see a decent price in $150+ range it’s a pretty good deal. I wish the connectivity was easier. It seems to default to the noise cancellation more often that I like and I have to figure out how to get back to the settings on various devices. You do need iOS upgrade to at least 18x to get full functionality. Recommend with those caveats.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Outstanding Sound and Noise Cancellation
reviewText: I recently picked up the Apple AirPods Pro 2, and I’m honestly blown away by how much they’ve improved. The sound quality is outstanding—rich, detailed, and clear across all types of music. The high-fidelity sound really stands out, especially when paired with the personalized spatial audio, which makes everything feel immersive. I love how the sound adjusts to my head movements, creating a more dynamic listening experience.The active noise cancellation (ANC) is incredible. I use these to tune out distractions during my commute or when I need to focus, and they work like a charm. Whether I’m on a noisy subway or just in a crowded room, the ANC blocks out most of the background noise, making it easy to hear my music or podcast clearly. There’s also the Transparency mode, which is great when I need to hear my surroundings without taking the earbuds out. It’s a perfect balance, especially if you’re walking or biking and still need to stay aware of your environment.Setup was super easy, just like with all Apple products. The seamless integration with my iPhone was a breeze, and connecting via Bluetooth was instant. The new H2 chip definitely delivers—everything feels snappy, and the sound quality is even more refined than the previous model.One feature that stood out to me is the hearing aid capability. It’s a nice touch for anyone who might need it, and it works surprisingly well. I didn’t expect this feature to be as useful as it is, but it made a difference in certain situations where I wanted to hear conversations more clearly without turning the volume up too high.The fit is comfortable and secure, thanks to the various ear tip sizes that help create a perfect seal. I can wear these for hours without discomfort. The new USB-C charging is a welcome upgrade too—charging is faster and more convenient, especially if you’re using other USB-C devices.There’s very little to complain about, but I will note that, like most true wireless earbuds, the battery life could be a bit longer if you’re using ANC and high volumes constantly. But with the charging case, I’ve found that it’s easy to top them off throughout the day.

    Better than I expectee
reviewText: I had been using a pair of Edifier earbuds for a while, which worked pretty well and had features such as noise cancelling.  I figured the Airpods Pro 2 would be similar, but they have some subtle extras that are really nice.  Being able to charge it with a magsafe charger is convenient.  It seems to integrate a bit better with the iPhone, as you'd imagine.  And most of all, the sound is really good.  I haven't done any back-to-back comparisons between this and other earbuds, but subjectively, I think it's quite good.  And then there's the hearing-aid functionality; what a great addition.So far, I don't think the noise cancellation is that different from other brands, and it just seems more similar than different to those Edifiers, but as always, Apple seems to have a more polished result.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2025

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Amazing hearing aids!
reviewText: Wow, amazing! I am a senior, senior citizen with a hearing deficiency. These earbud pro solve all my hearing issues. I had expensive hearing aids for nominal hearing loss. I used them when going out and at family gatherings. I had separate ear buds for watching TV. I also turned up the volume on my mobile phone. These earbuds pro do all that in one device! After the hearing test, it adapted it to all my hearing needs. My hearing aid were not as comfortable as these, and I don’t have to keep replacing the batteries. As a senior, I am not easily impressed, but these are amazing!
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2025

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    The best headphones I've ever used
reviewText: I've been using wireless audio devices since the original AirPods released, including the original AirPods, Beats X, Pixel Buds, Beats Flex, 2 different pairs of Anker Soundcore buds, and a pair of JBL over ears, and the AirPods Pro 2 are the best by far. The transparency mode allows me to have stereo audio while still being able to hear my surroundings incredibly well, while the noise cancelling mode cuts out 99% of the background audio. The gym at my university doesn't have a wall between the equipment area and the basketball courts, and these are able to drown out around 20 people playing basketball easily. The ability to wirelessly charge through standard Qi, Apple Watch chargers, and Magsafe chargers also means that I didn't have to worry about putting cables around my apartment to keep them charged, as I can just put them on my watch charger I have at my bed and desk.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2025

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Love em
reviewText: I have moderate hearing loss. I have used prescription hearing aids from Costco and OTC Eargo 6 with very little success. When I saw these headphone/hearing aids on sale for $155 in early December I said why not give them a try a minimum they would be good headphones. It took over 2 weeks for them to arrive and instructions are not very good. Thank goodness for You Tube. That said, once I ran a hearing test and had them up and running I am thrilled with how much they have improved my hearing. I love them. I wear them around the house and even to parties. People say that they are uncomfortable wearing them out socially because people will think you’re listening to music or something. Never had anyone ask me if I’m listening to music. I also wear them to the gym and put them in noise canceling mode. Cuts out all the noise. I have also linked them with Roku and can listen to audio from TV/streaming without bothering others in early morning.I would highly recommend these to anyone with mild or moderate hearing loss who is is reasonably tech savvy. If you want a pair of hearing aid that you can simply put in your ears and hear without any tweaking don’t buy this product. But for less than $200 it’s a great deal!!
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2025

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Perfect for casual wear!
reviewText: I was skeptical if I would enjoy AirPods and be able to keep track of them. I have had them for several months now and love them! I'm happy I spent a little more to get the Pro versus the original because the silicone makes all the difference when it comes to fit and comfort.My favorite time to use is casual wear, while I'm working, shopping, or doing house work. I have worn them to workout and the increased warmth of the body can make them slide around more and I feel like I can still hear a decent amount (with noise cancel feature on) within the gym environment.Also happy to report that I have not yet lost them! The tracking ability feature is huge to help locate them if I leave in a coat pocket or generally don't put them right back in the case.The battery life is amazing. I use mine all the time and I feel like I hardly ever have to charge them!

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great for the limitations they have in regards to audio quality.
reviewText: I wear these for a reason you will probably never read about anywhere else.  I almost always reach for my open-back over ear headphones so I can listen to lossless and I prefer the more natural soundstage with more minimal treble brightness over-emphasis.  I put on these AirPods for a while every now and then because it does one main thing that I like.  I like the fact that after wearing them for a while. I get a lot of earwax out of my ears the next day which in turn makes my wired headphones sound even better as well.  The closed back bass pumping in my ears does this.  This “feature” will work with any in-ear monitor.  The other feature I enjoy is the wireless design for when I am doing things like cooking.  They sound great I would give them an 8.0 out of 10. Amazon also proved the best price for these and they are genuine.  First thing I checked.  I also really love the soft braided usb-c cable that Apple includes with their products now including these AirPods.  Though I will miss the lightning connector.  I was able to put my deoxit metal contact enhancer on the lightning connector and I cannot with the usb-c.  Only downside.  When companies start utilizing lossless with wireless headphones then I may make the permanent switch, but as is… I feel it may be impossible for wireless headphones to ever achieve the fidelity of wired.  Even if lossless implemented.  But we will see.

reviewTitle:

La cancelación de ruido es impresionante, bloquea casi todo el sonido exterior, y el modo transparencia se siente muy natural.La batería también ha mejorado, me dura todo el día sin problema con cargas rápidas en el estuche. reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Apple AirPod Pro 2
reviewText: After a couple of weeks of use and comparing these to my older Bose Quiet Comfort Ear Buds, I like the sound quality and the lighter weight on the ears.  I am having a problem with the fit.  Apple supplies four sizes of ear cushions, ..... all of them too big for me.  I can't get them deep enough into the ear canal to get a solid fit.  The AirPods always feel like they are going to fall out (and a few times they did).  I contacted Apple support and they do not have a cure at this time.  I also feel like my older Bose did a better job at noise cancellation but that might have something to do with the fit.  Most people probably wouldn't have this concern and these would be a good choice.  One determining factor in trying the AirPod Pro 2's was the new hearing test app and well as the ability to use these as hearing aids for mild to moderate hearing loss individuals.  The software update for needed for this wasn't out yet at the time of reviewing this product and on a iPhone, you require IOS 18 or higher, also just coming out.

reviewTitle:

reviewText: Purchased hearing aid" from a company promising great results. They were OK (about $100 amplifiers) but squealed and whistled a lot. The Air Pod Pro 2 are superior in all aspects- music play is outstanding and the hearing aid function is amazing. Volume lowers and voices take priority. reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Hearing feature
reviewText: I’m sure the younger generation will have no problems with these but I am 71 years young and I bought them for the hearing  feature.  These do work when I have them in.  The problem is that they won’t stay in my ears.  They’re too expensive to worry about them falling out all of the time so I hardly use them.  If you have the right anatomy and they stay in you would probably love them.  The left EarPod will stay put but the right falls out no matter what I do.  When I do have the one left EarPod in I can hear the pronunciation of the word better but I would rather have them both in. reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Probably the best Apple buy and a steal at sale price but a couple of issues
reviewText: I was blown away with the sound and features of these airpods (and I am not easily impressed).  However, a couple of issues.  One I found that the standard fit is not terribly secure.  I had to add hooks for security and a tether to link the two airpods together.  They both connect on the stem so that fit is not affected.  Given the cost, you don't want to take a chance on losing one.  The hooks will help secure the pods in your ear, and the tether will help prevent loss.  The use of both is optional, of course.  You can get both for about $10.  The main downside of the hooks an tether is that they have to be removed to be able to place the airpods in the charger, so get hooks that are easy to remove.  Second issue is the tips, which are special to the airpods pro.  I found that the small, medium, large, and the ones that come with it, were not sufficient for a tight fit.  Probably will need others.  Luckily, the fit can be tested by the iphone.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great hearing aids, easy setup
reviewText: My mom has hearing problems, but she flat out refuses to get hearings aids. I don’t blame her-I wouldn’t either. I convinced her to try the AirPod Pro 2 and she agreed. When they first arrive, you will have to make sure the phone’s iOS is updated to the most recent version, pair the AirPods to the phone, and then put the AirPods in the case to charge for a bit. They will update their own software while charging. After that, the AirPods will be available for setup in the phone’s settings. I highly recommend doing the ear fit test before the hearing test- that way you know the hearing test results are accurate. One of her ears is worse than the other, so she wears that one AirPod when she needs to hear. That’s a great selling point for anyone who resists getting hearing aids, and it’s been working great for her. I can’t thank Apple enough for doing this!
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2025

reviewTitle:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Not bad, but not the best
reviewText: I extensively tested what I considered to be the top three earbuds for use with Apple products. Rated 1 (Poor) to 5 (Excellent).Bose QC UltraTreble:  4.5Mids:  4.5Bass:  5Immersive Sound:  4.5Overall Sound:  4.5+Noise Canceling:  5Bluetooth:  2.5Battery Life:  4Fit/Comfort:  4/4Controls:  4Beats Fit ProTreble:  4Mids:  4Bass:  3Immersive Sound:  3.5Overall Sound:  3.5Noise Canceling:  3.5Bluetooth:  4.5Battery Life:  4Fit/Comfort:  4/3.5Controls:  4Apple AirPods Pro2Treble:  4.5Mids:  4Bass:  2.5Immersive Sound:  4.5Overall Sound:  3.5+Noise Canceling:  3.5Bluetooth:  4.5Battery Life:  4Fit/Comfort:  3.5/4Controls:  2General impressions:The Bose were hands-down, the best sounding of any EarPods I’ve used. Highs and mids were crisp, the bass was super rich especially with enhancement through third-party equalizers such as Boom. The Bose app which is required, was not difficult to use. Immersive sound was fantastic. Noise cancellation was top in class. Bluetooth is a bit annoying, with occasional drops. The Bose two source Bluetooth set up in the app is a bit squirrelly and is better set up as a one source item.The Beats also had crisp highs and mids, however, the bass was somewhat wanting. In order to make the bass sound more punchy, the volume of the mids and highs is lessened during the hits in order to make it sound like there’s more bass than there actually is. I call this “fake bass“. The H1 chip makes it work well with Apple products and the immersive sound is good. Noise canceling is par. The ear fin does help hold them in your ear, but does get uncomfortable after a long period of use.The Apple AirPods also had crisp highs and mids, but the bass again was somewhat wanting. The AirPods had the same issue with “fake bass“. Enhancement with third-party equalizers doesn’t usually sound too good. Seems like these earbuds are meant for plug n play without any equalizer input from the user. The H2 chip sounds really nice with immersive sound.  Noise cancellation was also par. Controls were very difficult to use without knocking the buds out of your ears.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2025

reviewTitle:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Don't Understand The Hype
reviewText: Unless I was scammed and got a knock off version that was re-wrapped... I don't understand the hype for these.The sound quality is mediocre.The noise cancellation is top tier.The battery life is awful. The portable chargers battery life is also subpar.It constantly falls out of your ear. I know they have customizable options or attachments (3rd party) you can buy to fix that -- but when you're spending this much money it shouldn't be an issue in the first place.The price is way too much for what it offers. As of writing this review it's $180+. You could get far better over-the-ear wireless headphones for the same cost. With a 12h+ or even 24h+ battery life, better sound qualify, and more comfortable.The connection is horrible. I can't even walk to the kitchen without losing connection or getting a bunch of static. Which sucks, because that was one of my main reasons deciding on buying these. But what really sucks is that they don't reconnect properly. If it gets to static I have to turn them off and on or even when I'm back in a strong signal area it'll remain choppy audio. If I lose audio completely I also have to turn my Bluetooth off and on to reconnect them. They don't auto-reconnect.So the only real reason to buy these is because you don't want to wear something as bulky as over-the-ear headphones or want to be able to hide your headphones from other people seeing them. Part of my intention for buying it was for working out... but they just fall out too much. I'm not sure why it's such an issue. I don't have that issue with wired headphones of similar design. I get there's a wire stabilizing it... but it's not stabilizing it that much. Especially with how I like to wear mine as loose as possible.Overall... I regret the purchase. I have a $400+ set of over-the-ear wireless headphones and normally I wouldn't even consider wasting money on these. But a plastic piece broke and I'm unable to repair it meaning one side of the headphones just flops around and even trying to stabilize it with glue/tape never really made it better.I'd return these but I feel kind of weird about returning something that's been in my ear for countless hours. It's not like these don't have a purpose still though. They're always great as a back-up and are good for travelling.If you view these as only using in small bursts (4 hours or less) then these are pretty decent though still overpriced. Might have to waste another $15+ to get an attachment to keep it in your ear... but the concept of the earbuds are decent.It just kind of makes me wonder if there's better options out there. A superior product. I'm honestly disappointed in these and will probably rarely ever use them again when I eventually get something better or fix my other headset somehow.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2024

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars

reviewText: The sound quality is great, and I like using them for music, but the noise cancellation feature felt pretty uncomfortable for me. It’s disconcerting when you can’t hear what’s going on around you, so I ended up turning it off—and I’m much happier without it.What I Liked: • Great Sound: Music and podcasts sound crisp and clear. • Tracking Feature: This feature was a lifesaver when some teens picked up my earbuds when I sat them down at the park. I used my phone to track them down and got them back!What Could Be Better: • Noise Cancellation: If you like being aware of your surroundings, this might not be the feature for you. • Charging Quirks: Sometimes I have to adjust or remove the soft cushions before placing them in the case to make sure they charge properly.  I almost sent them into be serviced until I realized you could just remove the cushions to get them to seat properly and charge.Overall, these earbuds are great for sound quality and have cool features like tracking, but they come with a few quirks. reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Amazing
reviewText: I would give these airpods a rating on 6+ if I could.  They are amazing, and way beyond the other noise-canceling earphones I have tried.  The most amazing feature is the hearing test and the way that the airpods adjust to my specific hearing issues.  I didn't know, but was not surprised, that as an older man, my ability to hear high frequencies had decreased.  Not enough to be alarming, and not enough to even notice.  Overall the test indicated that my hearing was  ormal, but did drop off at higher frequencies. I did feel that most music I listened to was a bit drab, and thought it had to do with compression.  The airpods changed all that - the high frequencies are back, and my music sounds much brighter" and livelier.  These have really made music and audio much more enjoyable.  I will also mention that the noise cancellation feature is as good as it gets.  I can tune out a noisy coffee shop almost 100%!  Amazing performance and for such a reasonable price."

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    BEFORE YOU BUY Great as hearing aids if you know what you are doing.
reviewText: I actually bought these 4 different times because the first 3 did not say Air Pods Pro 2 on the box; it just said Air Pods Pro. If you look at the bottom of the box it will say 2nd generation. I was not made aware of this till after returning 3 boxes and finally bought them from Best Buy. The guy at the register gave me a box that said Air Pods Pro. I said this is not the Air Pods Pro 2 as you see that these are labeled here on Amazon. He said the 2nd generation is the Air Pods Pro 2, but it doesn't say that on the box. Wish I had known this.Also I could not access the hearing aid app, till I went on Youtube where I saw a short video by Danielle Ridley called  How to get NEW Hearing Features on the AirPods Pro 2 - Fix!.  The biggest thing i learned is your must have ios 18.1 or better. The MOST IMPORTANT THING to get the hearing aid feature turned on; you MUST PUT THE PODS AND THEIR CONTAINER NEXT TO OR ON TOP OF YOUR PHONE WHILE IT CHARGES so the phone will upload the hearing aid feature. I hope this helps. I have owned expensive hearing aids, in the past. I think these are the best i have owned.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Next Level
reviewText: I already had an Airpod Pro second generation that work well, but being a mature gentleman, I wanted these mainly as a gateway to hearing augmentation.  In short, this overdelivered in a good way.Once I got my phone upgraded, then waited for the firmware to be upgraded on the Airpods (yeah, you just sit there and wait), I finally got to take my hearing test with these.  It said I have minor hearing loss in my left ear and pretty much no hearing loss in my right.  All good.  Next, I turned on the hearing aid mode and was ushered into a rich world of sound.These things are really amazing as hearing aids.  While the sound was a little like sandpaper on a snare drum in a way, I could hear EVERYTHING.  I had no idea that a bare foot on carpet was so loud and distinctive, that you can tell who is coming.  It was like nothing I have experienced recently.As far as being a headset, the noise cancellation is phenomenal.  I fired up my random orbit sander and dialed in my workbench in peace and only a very pleasant, quiet sound.  I popped one out to make sure, and it was startling.  These things really do work in noise cancellation, almost as well as my 3M cup type hearing protection!I have been an engineer for over 35 years, and it takes a lot to blow my wig back, but these things did just that.If you are young, maybe they are only great"
reviewDate: but as a gentleman of 57 years
column6: these are well and truly amazing.  If you are over 50
column7: you need these in your life."

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Impressive sound after doing hearing test and frequency response adjustment
reviewText: I did purchase this AirPod Pro 2 for helping my hearing in large echoey classrooms and killing background noise in restaurants.However, when I tried the units with spatial audio and head tracking selected, especially when listening to concerts online, the sound was immersive, had great ambience, transients, and bass; sounding much like a Dolby Atmos system. Most impressive is when I turn my head and the sound source remains in place with the hearing frequency response changing as it would in an actual live situation.The hearing aid feature. After the hearing test was completed, and the AirPods automatically adjusted to my hearing losses, my hearing became as good as a bird. I could hear scraping of my shoes on a carpet, squeaking floors, distant sounds that I had not ever been able to hear. All this does depends on how good you’re hearing is in the first place. I had an audiology hearing report that I scanned into my iPad, which I could even tweak. That was a little better than the AirPod internal test.This purchase was well above my expectations using my Apple iPad.The sound quality was not anything to write home about with an Android phone. For that I would purchase something else as there is no dedicated app for the AirPod.I did need to watch a couple YouTube videos for setting up the AirPods, as the enclosed manual was not helpful.  Apple online documentation was fine, but not as good as watching someone actually doing a set up.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2024

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Seamless integration with Apple products, great quality sound
reviewText: I bought these to use for noise cancellation when traveling. I wear hearing aids full time, but they don't do much to reduce unwanted noise and are uncomfortable for long periods of time under noise-cancelling headphones. In my research I discovered that some earbuds now offer noise cancellation - and they'd fit more easily into my already tightly-packed personal item for flights. So I figured I could just switch out my hearing aids for the AirPods while on the plane. I was comparing reviews on these and the Bose Quiet Comfort II. Even though the Bose were rated slightly higher for noise cancellation, I decided to go with the Apple product because of the ease of linking to my other Apple devices.I haven't had a chance to test them out on a plane yet, but preliminary checks with a nearby hair dryer and vacuum indicate they'll be pretty effective. The sound quality is superb, and they are comfortable in my ears. I love that they come with 4 sizes of ear tips to allow for a good fit. The case is tiny, easy to fit in a pocket, and charges on an Apple watch or MagSafe charger or with a USB-C.I expected to use these only when traveling or in other loud environments. The surprise has been that I find myself wearing them at home in the evening, when I'm apt to be going between phone, iPad and computer for various uses. My hearing aids connect fine to my phone, but switching the bluetooth on them to another device is so cumbersome that I never even bother trying anymore. In contrast, once they are initially linked, the Apple AirPods connect automatically to all three devices and switch between them seamlessly. With the 30' bluetooth range, I have the freedom to move between rooms and still hear whatever I was listening to without having to carry a device with me. Even with significant hearing loss, the AirPods' clear sound allows me to take calls and hear the caller distinctly, and the outgoing microphone sound is also clear.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2024

reviewTitle:

reviewText: I was between these and a full size over the ear headset for noise cancellation. I went with these for ease of portability when traveling, multiple size ear bud tips, battery life and promised noise cancellation feature. Very satisfied with all of these features. As to noise cancellation, I wore them on several flights and heard nothing from my neighbors, seat mates and their devices, or even the flight  attendant offering beverages! Better still I could have the volume turned low and still experience excellent sound quality, another big plus if you have sensitive hearing. The standard size tips stayed put in my ears altho I prefer the next size down and pleased to have this option. I am not a tech person but the prompts to pair them  with your device and to check/charge battery life could not be easier. For me, these are worth every dollar.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Wow, just wow!
reviewText: Weather you are going from the first gen pros, normal AirPods, or any other headphones (except the AirPods Max) I’m sure you will be blown away by these, the sound quality is unbelievable, and the bass, the bass is insane! You might think that since they are earbuds that you might not be able to feel the bass, but not quite, for me, it’s like I have a actual bass next to me, it’s like it uses your heartbeat to make it feel like bass is around you, especially when you really feel the music, even though the beat isn’t right on with your heartbeat, that is the best I can describe it. And I do t k ow what happened, but with the iOS 18.1 update, everything changed in how good the audio was,  I came from the AirPods Pro 1st generation, so when I swapped to 2nd generation the audio difference strangely wasn’t much better, but after the iOS update, it was crazy! It sounded like there was the band or orchestra playing around me and swapping from ear to ear and fading, it feels more open and waaaay better! It is quite hard to describe, it’s really just something you have to try for yourself. I am absolutely blown away by these AirPods, these are the best sound quality earbuds I’ve ever put on, better than any headset I’ve put on! And the new speaker on the case is a nice piece of mind to have, I haven’t used the lanyard loop before but that’s just me. And the tracking for these in find my is so good, that I can lose them, and I can play the sound and use the find my app and it will play a have if hot and cold with me and it is accurate! One of my favorite features of these compared to the 1st generation is the volume control on the stem of the AirPod itself, I use this all the time. I highly recommend these!Edit: I found out why it was sounding so good and it is just the spacial audio on them that I toggled on, but still unbelievable sound.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Just came from the Airpod Pro's Version One's and These do not disappoint
reviewText: I recently purchased the AirPods Pro 2, and I must say they have exceeded all my expectations. From the moment I unboxed them, I was impressed by the sleek design and the premium feel they exude. The noise cancellation feature is nothing short of remarkable; it effortlessly blocks out distractions, allowing me to fully immerse myself in my music or podcasts. With the new adaptive transparency mode, I can seamlessly transition between enjoying my tunes and being aware of my surroundings, making them perfect for daily commutes.The sound quality is another standout feature. The deep bass, clear mids, and sparkling highs create an immersive audio experience that rivals many high-end headphones. Whether I'm listening to my favorite playlist or catching up on audiobooks, every note feels rich and vibrant. The spatial audio feature takes it a step further, providing an almost theatrical experience that is truly a game-changer.Battery life is fantastic as well. I find that I can easily get through a full day of use without needing to recharge, and the wireless charging case is incredibly convenient. For those who are always on the go, the quick connect feature with my Apple devices is a lifesaver; I can switch between my iPhone, iPad, and MacBook without missing a beat.Overall, I can’t recommend the AirPods Pro 2 enough. They beautifully blend functionality, style, and top-tier performance, making them a must-have accessory for anyone who values high-quality audio and convenience in their daily life. Truly a fantastic investment!

reviewText: I'm not crazy about the way they look (hanging out of your ears), but I do like the qualify of sound and sound cancellation. They charge quickly in the secure carry case, but older users, like me (77) may find it difficult to remove the  pods from their case because of the secure magnetic connection. I actually like how well they fit and consider it a minor but justifiable nuisance to remove them with my neurologically challenged hands. However, because they work so well, I can overlook this minor inconvenience. I have also tried using them a few times as hearing aid supplements, and they work pretty well (e.g., lectures). I have not found them useful at concerts or movies because the sound there is loud enough!

reviewText: I purchased the AirPods Pro 2 with MagSafe Charging Case/USB-C (A3047, A3048) and they are impressive.  The noise cancellation is outstanding, the Spatial Audio is incredible for earbuds and the different listening modes are fascinating.  They also charged quickly and are easy to pair.  Now for the 2 issues.  First, by using these earbuds, I found out that I have sensitivity to silicone in my ears so they caused irritation when I used these for more than 15 minutes.  Since I like these so much and Apple does not offer silicone-free ear tips, I purchased non-silicone tips (medium) from Amazon and I can now use these without irritation.  The other issue is that, although I was able to pair them with my LC C3, the Bluetooth connection suffered intermittent gaps in the audio. I tested watching the same movie on my iPad- no issues.  I'll work with LG to get this resolved.  For me, it's worth keeping these because they are truly outstanding

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    These work great, but are a little overpriced if you buy them at retail price.
reviewText: I bought these AirPod Pros on sale for $170 and have been very impressed with them. I work in a very loud environment, so the noise-cancellation mode helps reduce the sounds of what’s going on around me while producing clear sounds. Additionally, the battery life on these ear buds are fantastic; Sometimes, I don’t charge them for weeks.One of my favorite new features to AirPods is their “Find My” app accuracy. When I lost my original AirPod’s I would panic because the “Find My” wasn’t very precise and depended largely on when the last time they were used. However, the new feature allows you to literally track your lost AirPod case at anytime (with battery life) and takes the stress away of worrying if you left them at the gas station, store, or a friends house.Although these get a ton of hype, I am not super impressed with some of the features. The transparency mode always creates a lot of static sounds that distract from what is playing. The tips do not fit my ears like the original AirPods, so they are constantly falling out of my ear. I am also not very fond of the limited touch control options available with these AirPod’s. You cannot skip, restart, or go back to old songs, like with the original AirPod’s—it seems they digressed a little there—and I know this sounds picky, but it was very important to me as I am not always near my phone or am able to command Siri in my environment.I am very impressed with what has been offered in this product, but it is overpriced, like much of what Apple offers.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Superior Comfort
reviewText:
The Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) have quickly become my go-to wireless earbuds, offering a fantastic blend of immersive sound quality, comfort, and convenience. The personalized spatial audio feature is a standout, creating an immersive listening experience that makes music and podcasts feel more engaging. The sound is crisp and well-balanced, with impressive bass that doesn’t overpower the mids and highs.

One of the best aspects is the comfort. The redesigned shape fits snugly in my ears, and I can wear them for hours without any discomfort. They’re also sweat and water resistant, which is perfect for my workouts and outdoor activities. I don’t have to worry about them getting damaged by a bit of moisture, making them a reliable choice for various situations.

However, there are a few things to consider. While the sound quality is excellent, audiophiles might find it lacking compared to high-end, over-ear headphones. Additionally, the price is on the higher side, which might be a concern for those looking for more budget-friendly options.

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars
 🎧 Immersive Sound, Seamless Tech, But Not Quite Perfect for Everyone
reviewText:
When I first unboxed these earbuds, I felt a mix of excitement and skepticism. Would they live up to the hype? Spoiler: For the most part, they absolutely do but not without a couple of quirks.

🏆 The Good Stuff
Let me start with what blew me away: the sound. The bass is rich without overwhelming the mids and highs, creating a balanced listening experience. Pairing them with my phone was as effortless as opening the case they were ready to go before I even blinked. The spatial audio is no gimmick either; it adds a layer of immersion that makes you feel like you’re at a live concert.

Battery life? A solid win. I used them for nearly seven hours on a single charge, and the charging case gave me multiple full charges. It’s like having a mini powerhouse in my pocket.

🛑 The Not-So-Good
But—and this is a big one for me—the fit isn’t universal. If you’re someone who plans to use these during intense workouts or while running, you might find yourself readjusting them more often than you’d like. For casual use, they’re snug, but for activities, it’s a bit hit or miss.

Why It Stands Out
What really sets these apart is the combination of features and usability. I walked through multiple rooms in my house, and the connection remained rock solid a level of reliability I haven’t seen in many other earbuds. The controls are intuitive, and the subtle aesthetic of the design makes them feel premium.

Should You Buy Them?
If you’re looking for earbuds that excel in sound quality, ease of use, and everyday convenience, these are a fantastic choice. Just be aware that if you’re an athlete or someone who’s always on the move, they might not check every box.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2024

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars
 Balanced Sound and Comfort
reviewText:
The Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) have been a fantastic upgrade to my everyday audio experience. The personalized spatial audio is the standout feature—it creates an immersive listening environment, whether I’m enjoying music, podcasts, or taking calls. The sound quality is crisp and well-balanced, with just the right amount of bass, and the adaptive EQ adjusts perfectly to whatever I’m listening to.

Comfort is another highlight. The earbuds have a lightweight, ergonomic design that fits securely without feeling intrusive, even during long listening sessions or workouts. They’re also sweat and water-resistant, which gives me peace of mind when I’m exercising or caught in the rain. The battery life is excellent; the earbuds last about six hours on a single charge, and the Lightning charging case extends it to an impressive 30 hours.

While I’m happy with the overall experience, I do miss the silicone ear tips from the AirPods Pro for added noise isolation. These don’t have active noise cancellation, so they’re not ideal in very noisy environments. Also, they work best within the Apple ecosystem, so Android users might not get the full feature set.

Overall, the 3rd Gen AirPods are a great choice for Apple users seeking high-quality wireless earbuds with excellent sound, comfort, and battery life. They strike a good balance between premium features and ease of use, making them a worthwhile investment.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2024

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    An Honest Review
reviewText: First things first, I succumbed to Prime Day & couldn’t pass up the deal on these AirPods. Especially since with my current AirPods starting to crap out. However, I’m going to be giving this review from the perspective of going from the 2nd gen AirPod pros to the 3rd gen. And it seems like bit of a downgrade.Now, the 2nd gen pros have it all. The extra silicon tips, the noise cancellation & transparency, & the ability to wirelessly charge (the case). And I had them for a good long while (the longest I’ve had any AirPod) & the right bud is just starting to crackle when I play any audio through it and the battery is starting to go bad.Overall, I was honestly a little disappointed with the 3rd gen. Granted, it’s not a pro version so it’s not going to come with the noise cancellation. But the lack of silicon tips for the buds was a little surprising. I have trouble with any earbud staying in my left ear especially, & I’ve used the 3rd gen during a few workouts so far & they’re staying pretty well. But, they still feel just a little off & I ended up buying silicon tips to put over the buds instead - those helped with a bit of noise cancellation and security in my ears. But to go from the 2nd gen pros to the 3rd gen feels like I’m losing a lot when it comes to function & capabilities.Now, if you’re buying a pair of AirPods for the first time & just need the basics - then the 3rd gen is great. The bass sounds really good, overall sound quality is there & the buds without the silicon tips really aren’t that bad. If you’re used to that though, it’s going to take a bit to adjust with the 3rd gen. But, like I did, there are silicon tips you can get to put over the buds to help.

reviewTitle:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great Performance, But Packaging Issues and Battery Life Concerns
reviewText: I’ve used Apple AirPods before, and I got my previous pair directly from Apple, which worked flawlessly until my dog chewed one of them. That’s why I decided to buy these on Amazon. However, I’m not sure if it’s because the seller wasn’t directly affiliated with Apple, but these AirPods seemed used when I received them. There was dust inside the box, and one of the AirPods even had earwax or something on it. That was a big letdown for what was supposed to be a brand-new product.As for the AirPods themselves, they work well. The sound quality and spatial audio are excellent, just like my original pair. However, the battery life hasn’t been as good as expected. For the first two weeks, they held a charge fine, but now, after just about a month, the battery doesn’t last as long as it should. It’s a bit frustrating, especially since I expected the same long-lasting battery performance as my previous pair.Overall, I still love the AirPods, but the condition in which they arrived and the battery issues have me questioning whether this was truly a new product. I’m not sure if this is an issue with the seller, but it’s something to be aware of if you’re purchasing from a non-Apple source.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Apple AirPods Wireless Ear Buds, Bluetooth Headphones with Lightning Charging Case
reviewText:
The Apple AirPods are an excellent choice for anyone seeking high-quality wireless earbuds with seamless connectivity. Pairing with Apple devices is incredibly simple and almost instantaneous, thanks to the H1 chip, making these earbuds perfect for those deeply invested in the Apple ecosystem.

The sound quality is impressive, with balanced tones and clear audio, whether you're listening to music, podcasts, or making calls. The microphone quality for calls is also top-notch, ensuring your voice is heard clearly. The earbuds are lightweight, comfortable, and stay in place even during light physical activities.

The included Lightning Charging Case is compact and provides multiple charges, extending the AirPods' already decent battery life. While it would have been nice to have USB-C charging for more versatility, the Lightning connector works perfectly fine for Apple users.

Overall, these AirPods offer great convenience, reliable performance, and good sound quality. A must-have for any Apple user looking for wireless headphones!
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2024

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Great ear buds
reviewText: I own many Apple products and have been using them with over-the-ear wireless headphones. While they work well the ease of carrying them with me made it difficult depending on where I was traveling. The Air Pods were an excellent alternative. I caught an Amazon special and got them for an excellent price. Although they were not the latest model they were new and have excellent sound. As with all Apple products they quality and build are excellent. The small size and excellent connectivity of the Bluetooth make them useful for traveling light.

5.0 out of 5 stars
 Great Purchase
reviewText: The AirPods worked great and the packaging was just the same as if I were to buy directly from the Apple Store. The AirPods charge very fast and stay in my ears snug. I am moving a lot in my job and they do not fall out. They are easy to use and all controls work as far as volume and slipping songs. Music quality is great, no issues with the sound.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2025

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Amazing Sound and Convenience! Worth Every Penny! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
reviewText:
I couldn’t be happier with my AirPods! These earbuds have truly exceeded my expectations in every way. The sound quality is phenomenal, with deep bass, crisp highs, and a balanced midrange that makes listening to music, podcasts, or taking calls an absolute pleasure. The Active Noise Cancellation feature is a game-changer, effectively blocking out background noise so I can fully immerse myself in what I’m listening to. On the flip side, the Transparency Mode is perfect when I need to stay aware of my surroundings.

The seamless pairing with my devices is another huge plus. As an Apple user, switching between my iPhone, iPad, and MacBook is effortless. The fit is secure and comfortable, even during long listening sessions or workouts, and I appreciate the sweat and water resistance for added durability. The battery life is excellent, and the case provides multiple charges, keeping me powered up all day.

Pros:

Outstanding sound quality with rich bass and clear audio.
Active Noise Cancellation and Transparency Mode are impressive and easy to toggle.
Seamless pairing and switching between Apple devices.
Comfortable fit with multiple ear tip sizes included.
Excellent battery life and compact, portable charging case.
Cons:

Premium price point, though it’s justified by the quality.
Could be slightly uncomfortable for people with smaller ears after extended wear.
Overall, the AirPods are worth every penny if you're looking for top-notch wireless earbuds. They combine exceptional sound, convenience, and smart features in a sleek package. Highly recommended!
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2024

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Definitely worth every penny and then some
reviewText:
I love my AirPods. I thought about getting the AirPods Pro but I didn’t wanna spend that much more just to have the noise canceling feature. Now I will probably upgrade in a year or two now that they’ve even improved the AirPods Pro even more.

Coming from somebody who has an iPad and iPhone and an iMac at home having the AirPods and the ability to Switch between them so effortlessly without having to unpair and repair is so nice.
I’ve had a number of Bluetooth headsets over the years from Plantronics to generic to a number of other different companies I don’t even know if I could remember every different manufacture that I’ve had. I always hated that they were bulky they never fit in my ear just right. I just never felt like they were great and it was always complicated they seem to fuss to pair up and especially if they ever unpaired then it was starting all over again. I love that the minute that I got my AirPods I flipped open the case and right away my iPhone registers that they are there and with the top of a Button on my phone and the top of the button on the AirPods in a couple of seconds I am paired up.

I also have a very nice charger that I bought right here on Amazon for about $25 and it will charge my Apple Pencil my AirPods my Apple Watch and my iPhone all at the same time which is amazing and so nice that I can just click my AirPods case on there and they charge up in a very short time.

First off I’m not a sound engineer or an audio file so I can’t say that they have the absolute best sound quality and I’m sure that they don’t I can’t imagine that if you went out and got some of the beads or some other type of wireless headset that fits over your entire ear with a bigger driver in it that of course it’s going to have better sound quality.
But I love that they are tiny small and easy to just throw in the case. The battery life is great if my case is fully charged with the AirPods in and charged I can go to complete times to almost dead with both AirPods being used. If I only use one way talking on the phone I can go even more so in between case charging times is sometimes over a week which is absolutely amazing. The talk time on them is very long as well. I’ve never sat down and figured up exactly whether I get the exact time that Apple says.
I love that the minute that I put them in my ear I get a nice little tone to let me know that they’ve connected if I’m listening to music and I take them out it automatically pauses. I love that it will even pause my music if I get an iMessage and it will read my message it will tell me who it’s from if they’re in my contact list if not it will read me the phone number and then read me the message and then asked me if I would like to respond all without touching my phone.
I love Apple products even if they are a little more expensive in some areas but I love that for instance with the AirPods home they tie Effortlessly Into my phone my Mac and my iPad.
I absolutely hate when I am talking on the phone for more than a couple of minutes to have to hold the phone. Also I run a business and so I have to multitask sometimes someone calls and I need to be able to pick up a remote to navigate to something to check I may need to grab the computer etc. and having the ability to have both hands free to do something like that while still talking and not worrying about the AirPods falling out of my ear is worth more than the money that I paid for them by far and then all the other features that come with it are great.

So in the end I think that they are amazing and I’ve had it again a number of different Bluetooth headsets and they never fit right they fall out of my ear or the ones that took over my ears are always so uncomfortable after a short period of time that I never ended up using them I always ended up using my wired earbuds that come with my iPhone.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2020

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars
 Great for Everyday Use, But Not Perfect
reviewText:
The AirPods (2nd Gen) are a solid choice for wireless earbuds, and they’ve been a great companion for my day-to-day use. The pairing process with my iPhone was ridiculously easy—just open the case, and boom, they’re ready to go. The sound quality is decent, and the battery life is impressive. I can go a full day with moderate use without needing to recharge.

That said, they’re not without flaws. The fit isn’t the most secure for me—if I’m running or moving around a lot, I’m constantly readjusting them to keep them from falling out. Also, while the sound is good, it’s not exactly mind-blowing, especially for the price.

If you’re looking for convenience and decent performance, these are a great choice. Just don’t expect them to replace high-end headphones if you’re an audiophile. Tip: Keep the case clean—it’s a magnet for dust and lint!
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2024

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Very practical
reviewText:
Taking the Apple AirPods at face value, they're a solid headset for the money! If you already have the original, first generation AirPods and just want to upgrade, not a bad option either. The 2nd generation AirPods feature an improved software chip & runs off of BlueTooth 5.0 vs 4.1 (Gen 1). The software chip allows a faster, stronger, and more stable connection with your device(s). This particular item for $139.00 does NOT feature the wireless charging case. This one must be plugged in via USB (cable provided in the box) to an outlet or USB port. The wireless charging case model is $169. Now if you're looking to upgrade to the wireless charging case later on, you can. Apple does sell it separately. If you want the wireless charging option right out of the box, I recommend sending the $169 vs the $139 product here.

Sound quality: Straight out of the box, sound is pretty solid. No crackles, static, pops, or any abnormal noises created by the more economic-friendly headsets. You have a lot more adjustability & tuning capabilities if paired on an iOS/Apple device vs using for example paired with an Android OS device. So, ultimately Apple users may or may not get a better sound quality experience.

Noise cancellation: AirPods do fit fairly well in the ear without having to be jammed inside your ear canal. Generally they create a snug fit using Apple's universal" earphone design
reviewDate: it is one size fits most not one size fits all. Some users have upgraded or opted to spend the additional funds on a set of AirPods Pro due to the rubber tips for a better/snug fit. I believe only the AirPods Pro currently has an active noise cancellation utilizing two microphones but I would double-check Apple for accurate information. Also
column6: for Android users. The Galaxy buds by Samsung feature active noise cancellation & wireless charging case on every model so you might want to look into that product before making a final purchase.

asin: Battery life: For optimal battery life
reviewRating: I highly recommend charging both AirPods inside the case. The case itself is a battery pack with a life. So if one or both AirPods are low on battery
reviewTitle: you can toss them in the case and charge them up. Apple I believe rates 5 minutes of charging time is equivalent to 1 hour of talk/listening time and 15 minutes of charging time is equivalent to 2 hours of talk/listening. I'm sure this is accurate when they're brand new but I'm sure like anything
reviewText: normal ware & tare might diminish that over time.

asin: Warranty: Apple provides a 1-year standard manufacturer's warranty on this product. This ONLY covers defects/defaults from the manufacturer. This will NOT cover physical and/or liquid damages to AirPods
reviewTitle: or charging cable included.

asin: AppleCare: It's $29.00 and 2 years and well worth the extra money. You're already spending this kind of money on a headset
reviewRating: may as well have protection. We get it
reviewTitle: accidents happen! But protect yourself and get your AirPods repaired/replaced at no additional cost to YOU! There is no additional fees or deductibles involved.

asin: You don't have to install AppleCare right away. You have 60 days from the original purchase date to contact Apple by providing your AirPods serial number (on outside of the box) and Apple will tell you if you're still eligible.
You can renew AppleCare for another 2 years for the same fee of $29.00 provided you want to keep the same product. If you decide to upgrade to the AirPods Pro or whatever the latest model is
reviewRating: you would have to purchase AppleCare for that specific product.

asin: You can go into an Apple store location and get live repair/replacement on your AirPods.
Apple has allowed Android and other non-iOS devices to use AirPods since the AirPods pair/connect via BlueTooth.
If you're using AirPods on an Android platform such as Samsung or LG for example there's 2 ways to pair the headset to your device. You either turn on BlueTooth on your device
reviewRating: pop both AirPods inside your ear
reviewTitle: find "AirPods" under available connections
reviewText: and connect. Or you might have to pair manually using the button on the AirPods case to make available
reviewDate: pair
column6: and connect.

asin: You will NOT have access to all features that the AirPods have to offer on an Apple/iOS device. You will be limited on functions you can perform.

I was able to find an app on Google play store for $1.99 called "AirPopUp". It is a paid application that unlock access to certain/more features of the AirPods similar to what an Apple/iOS device would be granted. Be aware that you will NOT have access nor the ability to have every single feature since you're not on Apple's network. There may be other apps (most likely paid applications) you'd have to find that may unlock more features such as: AirPods battery life percentage
reviewTitle: programming LEFT & RIGHT AirPods for certain function(s)
reviewText: skipping/pausing/resetting songs
reviewDate: answer/decline/hang up phone calls
column6: find my AirPods
column7: and more.

reviewRating: you might want to look into the Galaxy Buds. They're a little cheaper than AirPods
reviewTitle: I believe Amazon has them for $109.99 + $22 3-Year insurance through Assurion that does cover physical/liquid/accidental damage just like AirPods.

asin: Pair with Samsung device to get the most
Comes in multiple colors (black/white/silver/yellow/red & black combo with Star Wars edition Galaxy Note 10+)
Includes changing cord and replacement rubber earbud tips.

I know if you pair the Galaxy Buds with a Samsung device it will automatically download an application titled "Galaxy Wearable". This allows users to check battery life status of the case and each bud
reviewTitle: ability to program LEFT & RIGHT earbuds to do certain function(s)
reviewText: answer/decline/hang up phone calls
reviewDate: pause/skip/reset songs.

asin: Apple may charge a lot of money for their products on accessories but they never fall short of being a revolutionary
reviewTitle: reliable product that works as advertised."

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 I can't live without these. And I mean that.
reviewText:
I literally have nothing negative to say. I'm a teenager who makes minimum wage and don't regret a single dollar I spent. I dropped one AirPod in a sink of soapy water, and it still works. The sound quality is AMAZING, and it gets very quiet and very loud as well. I can be in a silent room and still have it playing super quietly in the background. It easily and quickly connects and disconnects from all my devices, they never fall out of my ears (unless something touches/moves them like a jacket hood) and don't take very long to charge. I usually only have to charge them every couple of days and I keep them in for hourssss. BUY THEM.

The only negative (which I just thought of now) is that sometimes the location won't load when they're disconnected and you try to ping them. It just says connecting" and never goes through. Thankfully
reviewDate: I've been able to find them every time
column6: but don't depend on the ability to track them to be able to find them if they're lost. Sometimes the location will come through but it'll be a couple of hours old. What I do like is that you can pick which AirPod to ping
column7: or both (although you can't track/ping the case) and it pings pretty loudly!"
column8: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2025

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Decent value
reviewText: I purchased my AirPods in February of 2022 and thought I would do an update after 3 years of use. I use my AirPods everyday while working, at the gym, or on walks.When I first started using them in 2022, the AirPods battery life would last roughly 5.5 hours and the charging case could charge them roughly 5-6 times before it would also need to be charged.I paid $99 for them on sale as a full disclosure.Fast forward 3 years and the AirPods and case have both seemingly lost over 50% of their battery life.My AirPods only last about 2 hours before dying nowadays and the charging case can only charge them roughly 3 times before it needs to be charged.I still use them while working or at the gym, but can no longer use them while on walks as the battery dies too fast.$99 value makes me feel like I got my moneys worth but I do wish there was a bit more longevity.

column9: normal ware & tare might diminish that over time.Warranty: Apple provides a 1-year standard manufacturer's warranty on this product. This ONLY covers defects/defaults from the manufacturer. This will NOT cover physical and/or liquid damages to AirPods

You have 60 days from the original purchase date to contact Apple by providing your AirPods serial number (on outside of the box) and Apple will tell you if you're still eligible.You can renew AppleCare for another 2 years for the same fee of $29.00 provided you want to keep the same product. reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) Review
reviewText: The Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) have been a popular choice among wireless earbud users since their release. Here's a detailed review covering various aspects:#### Design and Build Quality- **Design**: The AirPods maintain the iconic, minimalist design with a white finish. They are compact, lightweight, and fit comfortably in most ears.- **Build Quality**: They are made of high-quality plastic, which feels durable and premium. The magnetic case is sturdy and ensures the earbuds stay in place.#### Sound Quality- **Audio Performance**: The sound quality is clear and well-balanced, suitable for a wide range of music genres. The bass is adequate, though not as deep as some premium alternatives.- **Microphone**: The microphone quality is excellent for calls, thanks to beamforming technology that reduces background noise.#### Connectivity- **Bluetooth**: The 2nd Generation AirPods use Bluetooth 5.0, providing a stable and efficient connection. Pairing is seamless, especially with Apple devices due to the H1 chip.- **H1 Chip**: This chip allows for faster and more stable wireless connections, improved sound quality, and hands-free Hey Siri" support.#### Battery Life- **Earbuds**: The earbuds offer up to 5 hours of listening time on a single charge.- **Charging Case**: The case provides multiple additional charges
reviewDate: extending the total battery life to more than 24 hours.- **Charging Options**: The case charges via a Lightning connector
column6: and there is a wireless charging case available as an optional upgrade.#### Features- **Automatic Ear Detection**: The AirPods automatically pause playback when you remove them from your ears and resume when you put them back in.- **Touch Controls**: You can double-tap to play or skip forward.- **Hey Siri**: Voice-activated Siri support allows for hands-free control.#### Compatibility- **Apple Ecosystem**: Seamless integration with iPhones
column7: iPads
column8: Macs
column9: and Apple Watches. Pairing is quick and easy
column10: with automatic device switching.- **Android Devices**: The AirPods can be used with Android devices
column11: though some features like automatic ear detection and Siri are not available.#### Pros and Cons**Pros:**- Seamless integration with Apple devices- Good sound quality- Long battery life with the charging case- Comfortable fit- Reliable connectivity with the H1 chip- Hands-free Siri support**Cons:**- Expensive compared to other wireless earbuds- Limited customization of touch controls- No active noise cancellation (ANC)- The white color can get dirty easily- Not ideal for audiophiles seeking superior sound quality#### ConclusionThe Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) are a solid choice for anyone deeply integrated into the Apple ecosystem
column12: offering convenience
column15: if you are looking for advanced features like noise cancellation or superior audio performance
column16: you might want to consider other options or the AirPods Pro.Overall
column17: they are a reliable and user-friendly option for everyday use

    Great Wireless Earbuds, But Fit May Not Be for Everyone
reviewText: Even Apple seems to be embracing the overly long, keyword-packed product titles these days, but the Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) live up to the hype for the most part. I originally bought these for my wife, who has no Apple products but loves the fit of Apple’s wired EarPods. These wireless AirPods fit the same, but for some reason, she found them uncomfortable to wear for extended periods.Ultimately, I passed them on to my son, who uses them with his Pixel 6a and an Asus laptop running Windows 11. He hasn’t experienced any issues, and they’ve been working flawlessly. The sound quality is excellent, the battery life is impressive, and the seamless connection is everything you’d expect from an Apple product—even when paired with non-Apple devices. Plus, the absence of rubber ear tips is a nice bonus for those who dislike them.While the fit wasn’t ideal for my wife, these AirPods have been perfect for my son. If the standard Apple EarPod shape works for you, these are a great option for wireless listening. Highly recommended—just keep in mind that fit can vary by person.
