reviewTitle:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Good, But Durability Issues and Auto-Switching Are Frustrating
reviewText: I’ve been using the Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) for a many years now. I've had 4 pair. (1 was lost and 2 were replaced due to faulty microphones.)I dislike the newer version with the easy-to-displace silicone tips. While the 2nd Gen offer great convenience and decent sound quality, they come with some very frustrating flaws. The seamless pairing with Apple devices is nice, and they’re comfortable for extended wear. The battery life has held up well, and the charging case is compact and easy to carry.However, the microphone durability is a major issue. After a few months of use, the microphones started failing, making calls difficult. I’ve had to take them to Apple multiple times for replacement under the 1-year warranty, which is great, but it’s still a hassle. For a premium product, I expected better longevity. Another big downside is the lack of a Bluetooth locator for the case—the AirPods themselves can be tracked, but if you misplace the case, you’re out of luck.The most annoying issue, though, is the automatic switching between devices. If I’m watching something on my laptop or TV via Bluetooth and an alarm or notification goes off on my iPhone or Apple Watch, the AirPods immediately switch to the alarm instead of staying connected to what I was originally listening to. It’s incredibly frustrating to constantly have to reconnect them manually. For the price, I expected more control over this feature. Overall, they’re decent, but these flaws make them far from perfect.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2025

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Amazing Upgrade – Worth Every Penny!
reviewText: I recently upgraded to the AirPods Pro 2, and I couldn't be happier with my decision! These earbuds are a significant improvement over the original AirPods Pro, and here's why they deserve five stars:**Exceptional Sound Quality:** The sound quality on the AirPods Pro 2 is phenomenal. The audio is crisp, clear, and well-balanced across all frequencies. Whether I'm listening to music, podcasts, or taking calls, everything sounds fantastic.**Superior Noise Cancellation:** The noise cancellation on these is next level. They effectively block out background noise, making my commute and work environment much more pleasant. The transparency mode is also improved, allowing me to hear my surroundings clearly when needed.**Comfortable Fit:** The redesigned ear tips and overall fit are incredibly comfortable. I can wear them for hours without any discomfort, and they stay securely in place during workouts and runs.**Long Battery Life:** The battery life has seen a noticeable upgrade. I can use them throughout the day with no worries about running out of charge. The quick charge feature is also a lifesaver for those times when I forget to charge them overnight.**Seamless Connectivity:** As expected from Apple, the connectivity is seamless. Pairing them with my iPhone and other Apple devices is effortless, and the connection remains stable even at a distance.**Sleek Design:** The design of the AirPods Pro 2 is sleek and stylish. The case is compact and easy to carry around, and the earbuds themselves look great.**Enhanced Features:** The new features like spatial audio and adaptive EQ make a noticeable difference in the listening experience. It feels like the sound is coming from all around me, providing an immersive experience.Overall, the AirPods Pro 2 is a fantastic upgrade that has exceeded my expectations in every way. They offer excellent sound quality, superb noise cancellation, and a comfortable fit, making them worth every penny. Highly recommended for anyone looking to elevate their audio experience!---I hope this review meets your needs! If you'd like any changes or additional details, just let me know.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2024

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Purchased these in Nov 2019 & still going strong
reviewText: I bought my 2nd gen Airpods back in 2019 and never expected for them to last this long. (In fact, I was a skeptic when Apple first announced how these things would stay in your ears.) Sounds quality hasn't diminished over time. It picks up ambient sound pretty well, sometimes making it hard for the caller to hear you. Sometimes it has a muted sound and the caller will say you sound muffled. So it's not perfect as a mic device but functions well enough most of the time that it's not a problem. Audio quality to me is great. Never have an issue with sound, music, or hearing a caller. They're not really noise-canceling, so if you're looking for that, you'll be disappointed. However, I've found that if I up the volume, it will drown out loud sounds. I don't like my volume extremely loud since I like to be able to hear what's going on around me, but for trains or large trucks rumbling by, the volume is excellent and still retains good quality. (Not that distortion sound that comes with playing music too loud.)Overall, I'd recommend. I've had this for nearly 5 years (bought it for myself as a Black Friday gift!), and I don't regret it. I see no need to upgrade to a Pro. Audiophiles may want surround sound type thing, in which I'd recommend a Pro, but 2nd gen works well enough for me (until prices drop for some of the newer ones).
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2024

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    IT’S REAL AIRPODS FROM APPLE
reviewText: After reading all the good reviews on here I decided to purchase the AirPods as well. These AirPods are for sure the real thing… if you’re worried that the AirPods are not authentic apple AirPods don’t be worried. It is Authentic! I even called Apple support to confirm my apple care for the AirPods and apple customer support verified it, All you have to do is give them the serial number, date of purchase and receipt. Keep in mind if you purchase the AirPods with Apple care, APPLE replaces the AirPods only if it’s damaged. You send them the damaged AirPod right or left OR Both and they send you a replacement…it does not cover the AirPods if it’s lost or stolen. Sound quality is Great and the cost of the AirPods is worth it. Also, it was fast shipping as well. The only bad thing I would say is the battery dies quick and I have to charge it every few hours.     Almost seamless integration
reviewText: I'm cheap. This was in large part why I resisted shelling out the money for these. Consequently, I tried several other Bluetooth earbuds, several on the decidedly cheap end of the scale. One of the problems I experience is finding earbuds that fit my ears. I have very small ear canals, so the earbuds that have the cone shape tip that fits into the ear canal either just won't fit, or are extremely painful after a short time. The only shape I've found that actually works for me are these, which I discovered with the first pair of wired Apple earbuds that came with a new iPhone several versions back.I included this picture, which shows the Airpods on the left and the much cheaper knock-off I tried. I thought I'd be okay with the shape of the cheap ones, but as you can see, they are actually much larger than the Airpods, so they were frequently falling out of my ears, especially when I was doing any physical activity.So, I bit the bullet and shelled out for the OGs. Here's my take:Pros:-Integration with other Apple products. I have an iPhone, iPad and Apple watch and these work quite seamlessly unlike any others I've tried. I put almost" in the title because I'm sure it will be improved on in further versions

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Another amazing Apple Product
reviewText:
As someone who has been using Apple products for over a decade, I have always admired their quality and innovation, and the AirPods Max headphones are no exception to this. While I’ve relied on AirPod Pros for most of my everyday needs, I’ve found that I absolutely love the AirPods Max even more for a variety of reasons.

First and foremost, the comfort level of these headphones is truly remarkable. They fit comfortably on my head, even during extended listening sessions, thanks to the well-padded ear cups and adjustable headband. This level of comfort makes them perfect for long hours of use, whether I’m working, traveling, or just relaxing at home.

The design of the AirPods Max is not only stylish but also incredibly practical. They’re easy to store, and the folding mechanism helps protect them when not in use. The connection process is seamless; they pair effortlessly with all my Apple devices, ensuring a hassle-free experience every time I put them on.

One minor drawback is the battery life, which, while decent, isn’t the absolute best compared to some other high-end headphones. However, it still manages to last through most of my daily activities, and the quick charge feature is a helpful addition.

Maintaining these headphones is straightforward as well. The materials are easy to clean, allowing me to keep them looking pristine with minimal effort. Plus, they look fantastic when worn, adding a sleek and modern touch to my appearance.

The sound quality is where the AirPods Max truly shines. The audio experience is top-notch—rich, clear, and immersive. The noise-cancelling feature works exceptionally well, providing an impressive level of isolation from external noises. Whether I’m at the gym, on an airplane, or lounging on the couch, the AirPods Max deliver a superb listening experience.

Overall, I highly recommend the Apple AirPods Max headphones to anyone looking for superior sound quality, excellent noise-cancelling capabilities, and exceptional comfort. They’ve quickly become my go-to choice for a premium audio experience, and they’re well worth the investment. If you’re in the market for high-quality headphones, the AirPods Max will not disappoint.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2024

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Amazing Cancellation on Long Haul Flights! I was hesitant to pay $$, but glad I did
reviewText:
Disclosures: I am immersed in the apple ecosystem. I am not compensated for my reviews in any way.

SUMMARY: Apple Airpods Max were not my first choice because of their relatively high price. I purchased from and returned to amazon a pair of new B*se QC headphones and replaced them with apple Airpods Max after three days. I have now travelled overseas with them and I am very impressed; in fact, I absolutely love them. They are the workhorse among fluffy, cheap plastic competing headphones. Solid performance during punishing overseas flights and ground travel.

PRO: ** Sound quality was superb and far superior to the competing product that I returned to amazon. ** I fully charged the Airpods Max to 100% and without recharging them, watched several full length movies and streamed live and saved music nonstop; they held their charge for well over 21 hours, when my flight reached its final destination, they were at 0%, but were still cancelling noise and performing almost 23 hours later. ** Quality Construction, look and feel, ** Analog Volume and sound mode controls are easier to find and use than the features on the pair I returned, ** Comfort & Fit on large heads – I have a large head and cannot feel the 13.6 ounces of weight, however, my petite wife found them to be too heavy for her pretty little head. ** At first, I hated, now I LOVE the protective “bra” case because easily went in and out of my carry-on laptop bag 100x without taking up coveted real estate inside… it now makes sense to me. ** Many very inexpensive after-market silicon covers are available to protect areas of the device that the “bra” does not cover, including the mesh headband. ** I tested the Noise Cancellation feature on two, 10 hour overseas flights and four, 3 hour domestic flights over a two week period. My previous headphones did a nice job of cancelling airplane noise, the Airpods Max were even better—much better because almost completely neutralized almost all ambient aircraft noise; I slept on the airplane feeling like I was not wedged in among 300+ other people. ** The 8 microphones comprising the sound “transparency” feature did a very nice job of allowing me to hear airport/airplane announcements, while still warding off, whie still giving unwanted chit-chatters a sense that I could not hear them.**

CON:

**As noted, the Price seems high at first, but my field test of Airpods Max during my recent marathon overseas trips proved to me that spending an extra $150-$200 (I found a better price on amazon than at apple store) was worth every penny. No buyer’s remorse here. **Charging to 100% is not quick; give yourself overnight. **If you have a small head or a weak neck, the weight of Airpods Max might bother you, but if you don’t and you’re looking for a sturdy, stainless steel framed, (aluminum earcups) work horse with amazing technology, buy these. **I purchased apple’s proprietary cord to connect with the airline’s onboard entertainment system…it worked fine, but shame on apple for charging so much for a cable, which should be about 10 to 12 inches longer.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2024

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars
 Excellent headphones, made in the typical first draft" Apple way"
reviewText:
Full disclosure: I purchased these headphones back in April 2021 and gave them some break-in time (until June 2021) before I reviewed them, so this is my experience of having them for more than 90 Days.

I owned a pair of Beats Studio Wireless 2's for about 4 years, and they were a useable set of cans. They had some pretty smart wired connections, good battery life, and were rather comfy to wear... but their wireless connections were a nightmare, the integrated Mic awful, and the noise-canceling mediocre. I was looking for a change, and being a consumer of Apple Products and with the generally good reviews I had seen for the Airpod Max, I decided to take the (kind of) expensive plunge. And honestly, I was not disappointed.

As with any good review, we'll break it down into the Pros & Cons and explore both.

BUILD QUALITY/DESIGN

PROS:

The build quality on these headphones is nothing short of phenomenal. They are made of Metal and some nylon or rubber here and there (for the headband and earcup padding) and they feel VERY SOLID. The piston style adjustments on the headband always feel super tight and mechanical (still even months after using them). The earcups are always tight on my head, allowing the headphones to clamp down on my ears and prevent noise leakage. The Earcups are built out of what looks to be a rubberized polycarbonate and padded mesh fabric and are held in by MAGNETS, making them easy to replace if they get soiled or if you want a different color.

Also, found out after the fact, the headband is ALSO replaceable if you want a different color later on down the line. The metal the speaker boxes are made from are the standard matte Apple aluminum, and the control buttons on the right speaker box are on par with the dials and buttons included on their Apple Watches (in fact, I'm pretty sure they're the same buttons, just upsized" in the CAD program when making this device). It all feels very expensive and well built
reviewDate: and even 100+ days after initial use
column6: still feels "brand new" and solid.

asin: Whereas I love the build quality
reviewRating: there are some pretty glaring design flaws and comfort issues that come along with this first outing from Apple.
whereas the headphones still fit like they were brand new
reviewTitle: I'd hope for some relief on the hard clamping aspect present in them. When I first wore them
reviewText: I was finding the clamping done by the headphones very tight and threatening to give me a headache if I wore them too long since it was like a vise on my head. This has lessened slightly over time
reviewDate: but it is still very tight. I don't know of a fix for this outside of constant wear to try and get them to bend a flex to a less tight shape on my dome
column6: but so far they still hurt a bit when wearing them for an extended time.

reviewRating: even though I like the good piston mechanics on the ear height adjustment with the headband since it takes some force to properly adjust them
reviewTitle: sometimes you have to grip on the speaker boxes and pull downwards on them while pushing upwards on the headband with your cranium to get them to adjust to your liking. This wouldn't be an issue if the dial and button were on the bottom of the headphones
reviewText: but since they're on the top of the right speaker box
reviewDate: it is notoriously difficult to adjust them on your head and not accidentally press one of the buttons
column6: causing playback or the headphones to go into pair mode (which happens if you hold down the buttons for too long). You'd think
column7: "oh
column8: just grab the sides of the speaker boxes"
column9: which makes sense
column10: however as I stated they are made of Apple's standard aluminum
column11: and to add to that the edges are very rounded
column12: so getting a grip on the side of the headphone speaker boxes is difficult at best.

asin: PROS: The sound quality on these is an absolute beast
reviewRating: and it's by far the best pair of headphones I've ever used. The audio is clear
reviewTitle: and you can hear highs
reviewText: lows
reviewDate: and everything in between. However
column6: I will be the first to admit
column7: while I am musically inclined and love listening to audio
column8: I'm by no means an Audiophile or claim to be able to hear what types of sounds are being emitted cleanly and loudly
column9: and which aren't. I usually can if I have good reference
column10: but as these are the best headphones I've ever owned
column11: so they become the new baseline. Also
column12: the built in noise canceling is the best in the business right now
column13: and is definitely better than its closest competitor. The reason why it is so good is due to the multiple microphones established in the soundbox housing
column14: which not only work EXTREMELY well for the ANC
column15: but also for phone calls. The phone calls made from these headphones are nearly studio mic grade in how they sound
column16: and are much better than most things included on computers or competitor headphones nowadays.

asin: CONS: Though I am not an audiophile
reviewRating: there is something that I can tell— when there is killer bass and when there isn't. And to my ears
reviewTitle: these don't have a superheavy bass that will rattle your fillings
reviewText: which is *fine*
reviewDate: but I thought there would simply be *more* bass in the audio. The bass may be enough for most music
column6: and what it has is ok
column7: but nothing akin to the huge bass I was *expecting*. The nice thing is that if you delve into the Accessibility Settings for your Apple product
column8: you can set an audio profile for the headphones so it'll enhance the audio based on how well you hear (so already
column9: this enhancement is *proprietary*; not a big deal for me as I own nothing but Apple devices
column10: but YMMV).

reviewRating: the handoff of the headphones to the other devices works really
reviewTitle: really well and hasn't needed to be paired more than once to each device it is used on. The pairing process is nicely simple if it does go wonky
reviewText: and doesn't have nearly as many issues as other BT that gets locked into a single device. The equipment/accessories that it comes with are acceptable (charging lightning cable
reviewDate: bra-esque "case"). The stop/start/volume dial is very responsive and easy to click using the same click sequence that Airpod Pros have used for a while (Double click to advance
column6: triple-click to go back

column8: etc...). If you take them off your head
column9: the headphones have a similar light sensor that other Airpods have to determine if they're in your ears or not
column10: and will halt the music accordingly or start playing if they recognize they're back in place on your head. The lightning cable to charge the headphones is embedded in the base of the right-hand speaker box
column11: and charges using the same style cable that your iPhone and old Airpods do
column12: so you should already have at least one cable for it if you own Apple products.

reviewRating: ok. So with any early adopter technology
reviewTitle: there's always going to be some bugs that need working out
reviewText: or some design flaw that (where not crippling) makes the headphones more of a chore and less fun to use. This may be our longest section
reviewDate: but please take these with a grain of salt— none of these are dealbreakers for *me*
column6: but since I'm not you
column7: YMMV. Here are the issues I found in no particular order
column8: but NEED to be discussed as I've often seen them glossed over elsewhere—

asin: - Analogue Connection. There is no direct analogue connection with these headphones. As most audiophioles claim
reviewRating: digital (especially wireless digital) will never be an acceptable connection replacement for analogue. And most high-grade cans have some sort of analog 3.5mm jack that can be plugged into a normal headphone port that will allow you to use these headphones with devices that don't transmit via BT
reviewTitle: like a Record Player
reviewText: or high-end sound system. The Airpods Max unfortunately have no such analogue connection. "But!" you may exclaim
reviewDate: "You can always use the Lightning port and plugin a Lightning to 3.5mm converter cable!" This is true... to an extent. First off
column6: to get that feature to work
column7: you need to get a SPECIFIC cable— Apple's Lighting to 3.5mm cable. The reason? Because that cable
column8: and seemingly ONLY that cable
column9: is BI-DIRECTIONAL. This means that no matter what end you plug your source into
column10: that cable will translate the audio both ways. Most to all third-party cables (that I was able to find in my research) are like an annoying 13-year-old listening to music in 2011: all they play is ONE DIRECTION. Also
column11: to top off the annoyance
column12: when you DO use the Apple Cable
column15: whose signal is then converted to digital. Automatically
column17: every time. This may be a problem for some people who demand their Analogue output to be heard in its original analogue glory. Also
column18: the Apple cable that you HAVE to use is super cheap feeling and thin
column19: instead of the normal thick or braided casing most headphone cables use. Did I mention that Apple also DOES NOT include this cable with the headphones? It's extra. Like about $30-$40 extra. So you may be better off with another set of headphones if you want a good

asin: - The "Case". I feel like the case that is included with these headphones will go down in history alongside the 1998 iMac USB Puck mouse
reviewTitle: and the Magic Mouse Lightning port as one of their more GLORIOUSLY STUPID design decisions. The "case" is made of what I can assume is leather

There supposedly is a magnet included in the area where the headphone edges touch that triggers an internal reed switch to put the cans in standby mode. Half the "case" is exposed to the elements and doesn't fully cover the electronics

column7: and most egregious

column11: and it's almost imperative if you live in a place with inclement weather. I bought a full zip case that has a built-in magnet for the reed switch

column15: and I really can't see a counterargument to either of those things.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Great over-ear headphones - but ears get warm after wearing for more than 30 min
reviewText: Can't say it any simpler - it's an Apple product. It looks great, sounds great, link very easily to my other Apple products. Yes, they are expensive but I anticipate that the materials used will last for years. The noise cancellation is spooky good - and very handy on planes. Only shortcoming is that after 30-40 minutes of wearing, my ears do get warm; but I think that is the same for all over-ear headphones. For me I can deal with warmth, in contrast to the discomfort of on-ear headphones on long flights or extended wear. I have worn them for a few workouts, but honestly, when you lay on a bench, they tend to slide off. even when I adjust the headband to fit snugly. Therefore, I don't recommend them for gym wear especially if doing free weights or machines that you are not vertical. I purchased the light silver pods with white headband, which is great for a person like me who wants a minimalist look. Would buy again, but wait for good sale. Recommend.

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Here’s what you need to know.
reviewText: Just a little disclaimer I’m not an audiophile.Noise cancelling is great in fact This works really well, almost too well, for someone who is a college student and is stuck in a study lounge with a bunch of other students gossiping and being loud, just throw these bad boys on and they are gone! Or if you want to gossip with them but don’t feel like taking off your headphones, the transparency mode is this really cool pass through sound, with such detail that it’s like you took off the headphones, it’s actually my favorite part and I leave this on majority of the time. You can also turn off either of these modes.These headphones are very heavy as it’s made out of quality materials. I’ve seen headphones quadruple the price point and they were NOT made out of materials this nice. It just looks like a premium product to me.Unfortunately, the case is…. Horrendous, I’ve literally couldn’t fit it in my bag one time and I had to carry it and it was like a mini purse. If I were to drop it down on the ground, it probably would’ve demolished the whole headphone. There’s really no way around this either because there is no way to turn off the headphone without putting it inside this bra… I mean case.Battery life is great. To be honest I don’t use my headphones very often, but they hold their charge very well. I probably charge it every 2 weeks.Sound quality is great, especially with songs supporting Dolby atmos.I would definitely explore your other options first. These are getting quite old and Apple is releasing newer ones.I’ve also heard issues of condensation from your EARS getting inside the actual headphones itself, yes the INSIDE of the headphones where the components are and Apple says it is not even the slightest bit splash resident or waterproof.I was curious, wore this for 15 minutes getting a small quiz done. Took the ear cap off and the ENTIRE inside of the ear cup was SOAKED. and I wasn’t even sweaty or anything. I’ve had people on Reddit or other reviewers say this completely broke their headphones and when they went to get it fixed, Apple told them it was their fault.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2024

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    A very expensive pair of bluetooth headphones that won't break so easily.
reviewText: I've been through multiple pairs of bluetooth, DJ orientated, and even audio headphones over the years, and for the consumer grade they still are, they're one of the few bluetooth headsets that have metal hinges. Finally! I only had to spend 500 bucks, but they won't snap at the hinge like so many pairs of Sony, Technics, and a few other brands not worth mentioning! This right there is almost worth the cost considering the plastic brands are more or less disposable over the years.The sound quality is good enough. Not overly bass heavy like Beats. Not 500 dollar wired headphones hooked up to a nice amplifier playing records of an analog mixing desk, but good. I'm going to guess if you expect that level of sound quality a bluetooth protocol that you're a lost hope in the first place.My real problem is that as you wear the headset, the ear pads and the headband will start to discolor from your skin oils, and if you wear the headset as often as I do (I use it to block out a partner who has a chainsaw in her head at night), the earpads will start to stink. The pads are removable and replaceable (at 70 dollars a set!), but they stain pretty quickly. I bought the silver units and wish I got the space grey. Be aware of this if you plan to use them for sleeping purposes.Not much else on the market really matches. I wish Sony/Technics/etc would get the memo.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2024

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great sound but easily scratched
reviewText: These are great headphones. Overall, the aesthetic is very clean and you look cool wearing them. Weight wise, they are lighter than you'd think for metal based over-ear headphones. I've worn them for hours and they don't get uncomfortable in the way that some headphones can after long periods. The noise cancelation is fantastic and so it the audio feedback when you listen to music. The quality of sound is clear. An added perk is that if you have other apple products, the compatibility and connectivity is seamless.  You can bounce between different apple products without any issue.Very happy with the purchase. I will say, if you want quality headphones, you definitely don't have to go with this pricetag. However, if you do, you won't regret it.  Only negative is that they don't come with outside ear covers. So be careful about scratching them.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2024

It's unnecessary to the design. Dumb.No way to plug in for wired use, except for the apple charge to mini jack converter. reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Apple AirPods Max: A Masterpiece of Audio Engineering
reviewText: Apple's AirPods Max headphones are a true marvel of audio engineering. From the moment you open the sleek, minimalist packaging, to the first time you slip them over your ears, the AirPods Max exude a sense of quality and refinement that is unmatched in the industry.Design and ComfortThe AirPods Max are not just headphones; they are a statement piece. The sleek, stainless steel frame is beautifully sculpted, and the plush ear cushions are incredibly comfortable, even for extended listening sessions. The knit-mesh canopy ensures a perfect fit, and the overall design is simply stunning.Audio QualityThe AirPods Max deliver truly exceptional audio quality. The custom-designed dynamic driver produces a rich, detailed soundstage that is sure to please even the most discerning audiophiles. The bass is deep and impactful, the mids are clear and present, and the highs are crisp and defined.Active Noise CancellationThe Active Noise Cancellation (ANC) on the AirPods Max is simply the best in the business. It effectively blocks out all ambient noise, allowing you to fully immerse yourself in your music, movies, or podcasts. The Transparency mode is also a great feature, allowing you to stay aware of your surroundings without having to remove your headphones.The AirPods Max are packed with features, including:Personalized Spatial Audio with dynamic head trackingDolby Atmos supportAutomatic switching between Apple devicesUp to 20 hours of battery lifeEasy pairing and setupThe Apple AirPods Max headphones are the best wireless headphones on the market. They offer exceptional audio quality, industry-leading ANC, a stunning design, and a host of useful features. If you are looking for the ultimate listening experience, the AirPods Max are the only way to go.Pros:Exceptional audio qualityIndustry-leading ANCStunning designComfortable fitLong battery lifeEasy pairing and setupCons:ExpensiveConclusionThe Apple AirPods Max are a true masterclass in audio engineering. They offer an unparalleled listening experience that is sure to please even the most discerning audiophiles. If you are looking for the best headphones money can buy, the AirPods Max are the only option.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2023

    Amazing Noise Cancellation and Surprisingly Durable!
reviewText: I've had my AirPods Max headphones for over 2 years now, and I've had no issues with them or had signs of heavy battery drain/deterioration. These headphones are amazing for their noise cancellation - they are my go to for when I want to study or work and block out noises. I won't lie and say they are my best headphones as my Sony headphones are better when reviewing from an audiophile's perspective (and cheaper), but this product is amazing for what it does. And as expected it works seamlessly with other apple products being able to switch from my devices based on what it picks up as the priority device (i.e. listening to music on my iPhone then picking up my iPad to watch something on YouTube and the headphones switches the audio connection to the iPad). I also like how customizable it is, and the ease of cleaning or even replacing the ear cushions. I love these headphones, and I hope they continue to last me for a long time until Apple releases an upgraded version!

reviewText: I don’t think I qualify as an audiophile but I have owned lots of different headsets and earbuds from many different makers (Bose, Beats, etc.) After having these for a few weeks I give them an average rating. I don’t think the sound quality is all that outstanding. I hear distortion in some of the highs. And yes I tried adjusting equalizer settings. For nearly 500 bucks I’d expect better from any manufacturer and I think Apple is getting away with one here. If these weren’t carrying the Apple logo they’d be worth maybe 200 bucks. I’ve had to use “Forget device” quite a few times to get them to connect on different devices (phone, iPad, MacBook) and that’s pretty frustrating when you’ve handed Apple so much dough. So if you’re in the market, I’d go with the Bose.

reviewTitle:
2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great sound and material quality but unfortunately very heavy and uncomfortable
reviewText: I'm no Apple fanboy, but to keep things simpler I try to keep my technology within a single ecosystem if possible, given how unreliable computers and related technology often are. Apple also has a better than average track record for hardware and industrial design (their software is no better than anyone else's nowadays, IMHO).Anyway, I *really* wanted to like the AirPods Max (too similar a name to their AirPods Pro, so easily confused... dumb). The sound quality is very good and the material quality (mostly metal) is impressive---but along with this comes excessive weight for wearing beyond an hour or so, mostly around the ears, and also too much clamping" force as is often described. I don't have an abnormally large head and I am fit and relatively healthy. I should be considered a typical user/consumer. I always assumed that Apple did thorough product testing (?). Did they really? In this case
reviewDate: I don't see how they could release this product and keep it as-is for 4+ years given the inherent design flaws. I've now read online that a lot of people have issues with the weight and discomfort these headphones as it turns out. Caveat emptor
column6: I should have researched better before buying them.I hope Apple pays some attention outside their walled garden as to how their products are received and makes improvements commensurate to their process and products. I hope the next version of these headphones are lighter and more ergonomic; if so
column7: then I'll consider getting them---after doing better research first.Also
column8: returning these through Amazon is a royal PITA---not the usual process
column9: because once you activate these headphones they become part of your Apple account
column10: which you have to delete
column11: either before or after contacting Amazon customer service
column12: blah blah blah. Then they send a UPS driver to pick up the return on the next business day
column13: so you have to be home. Lots of hassles and time wasted. I won't buy from Amazon any Apple product that uses telemetry again. Better off going to an Apple Store."

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    BEST headphones I’ve ever owned! WARNING ⚠️ however
reviewText: The sound quality on these are freaking amazing between Dolby Vision surround sound for movies, or the thumping bass and spatial audio listening to music, it’s like nothing I’ve literally ever heard. One HUGE problem if you’re similar to myself— Condensation. From even minor ear sweat, these things will not bode well as time wears on. Just check the AirpodMax subReddit. It’s filled with many complaints of disconnecting, no longer working units. I’ve had them 3 weeks and they just stopped working and would no longer connect as of yesterday. I clean the condensation out regularly just to prevent this, but it didn’t matter. Thankfully, this morning I woke up and they must’ve dried out completely and are working again. ☺️ If you still decide to purchase these, GET APPLE CARE!! I use these at my warehouse job and I get minor ear sweat so I made sure to get Apple Care just in case. For $500 it’s a no brainer, especially reading many people on Reddit’s several exchanges.Bottom Line: Absolutely Amazing headphones for CASUAL use. For moderate moving around they’re sustainable if you make sure to monitor the condensation. Thankfully the magnet ear pads make this very easy. You will NOT be able to workout in these or sit in the sun relaxing. You’ve been warned.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2022

reviewTitle:
2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Good Design, One Important Flaw
reviewText: The sound quality and noise cancelation are excellent.  They connect to macOS devices easily.  I like their performance and would have gone with 4-5 /5 if not for a significant design choice that makes their use a problem (at least for me).The ear cups are removable (great!) but held in place only with magnets.  If you use headphones often, you know oils and dirt build up on them and so many people use removable cloth covers to keep the hardware clean and reduce irritation.  These covers (I have many different ones) are held in place with an elastic band so they can be easily removed and laundered.That's where the magnets are a problem.  The elastic pulls through the magnets and the cups won't stay on the headset.  Tried a few different ways to attach covers, they all fail because the elastic pull is stronger than the magnetic connection.Directions for cleaning the cups don't indicate they can be laundered.  The suggested cleaning process is laborious and full of disclaimers about their fragility.  Magnets are a neat trick. Apple likes playing with magnetic connections, but I think a latch would have been a better design.Looking forward to the second generation.  This is a solid first effort, but I'm gonna have to return mine.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2024

The noise cancelation is better on the Airpods Max than on any other headphones or earbuds I own or have owned with noise cancelation on board. I can listen to a podcast or a tv show etc while vacuuming the house for example and I don't strain to pick out dialogue or delicate passages of music etc. The sound quality is crisp and clear without being harsh on the high end. I am very happy with these headphones. The one con for me would be battery life. I hope that when they release the next generation of the Airpods Max, they can improve the battery life. Otherwise, these are my favorite headphones hands down.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 10/10 - Wish I would've got these sooner!
reviewText:
10/10 sound quality
10/10 noise cancellation
10/10 comfortability
10/10 durability

The sound quality surpassed my expectations when watching shows or listening to music. Everything is crispy and clear! Noise cancellation is great, but do keep in mind that if the environment is really loud, you may still hear a bit of it through the headphones. It doesn't bug me too much and helps brings some peace and quiet when necessary. When first receiving the headphones, wearing them cause a bit of soreness cuz I felt like my head was being squished. After wearing them for long periods of time, you kind of break them in and they will become more comfortable that you don't even notice them. Prior to owning the AirPods Max, I owned that AirPods Pros and they were uncomfortable after a few hours of wears. When comparing the two, the Max is definitely the best overall. Every single day I'll pack them in my bag for work and they've held up! Durability is definitely there, and tbh there's really no need to purchase an extra case since it gets really bulky. I had purchased a case only to never use it unless I feel like it's necessary to be used.

Its worth the investment!
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2024

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 The best Bluetooth true wireless headphones I've own
reviewText:
I've owned the Bose QC series, Sony WH1000XM3 & M4's, Bowers & Wilkins Px8, Panda. The Apple AirPod Max are the best, in terms of clarity and soundstage, I've tried so far. I also owned a pair of Sennheiser HD 800s - these are wired, but the AirPod Max is the only wireless headphone had even approaches the HD 800 in audio soundstage and overall quality. To note, I do use Apple Music, so I'm sure this only adds to why the AirPod Max's sound so good.
The Max's are a bit hefty, but by design, are well balanced - the result is a solid headphone is quite comfortable (I've worn them on a 9 hour flight with no issues).
I have to admit that when the return window came, I found that I couldn't live without these.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2025

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Threes are a step up from other ANC headphones.
reviewText:
With headphones I think sound quality is paramount and these offer excellent sound quality compared to the headphones I’ve tried (Sony xm4,Momentum 4,Beats Studio pro). I’m no audiophile but do enjoy sound and these are really nice. The Spatial Audio is surprisingly good. Not all SA songs sound as good as others but some songs will definitely make you turn your heads to see where the sound is coming from.

The ANC is really good. I haven’t been on an airplane with these but around the house they really shut the noise out.

Transparency mode it’s just like not wearing headphones. Perfect.

Some of the negatives are that they are heavier than other headphones but I this hasn’t been an issue at all. The case is kind of a meme at this point. I use it day to day but did buy a 3rd party case for travel as the Apple case isn’t very protective.

I hope this help you decide. No regrets here.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2025

reviewTitle:

reviewTitle:
1.0 out of 5 stars
 Critical design flaws make these headphones a dealbreaker for anyone that values their money/time.
reviewText:
Do yourself a favor and pass on these trash headphones. The poor quality headband and “condensation gate” issue should be a dealbreaker enough to pass on these headphones entirely. They are not worth your consideration. The sound quality, ANC, and transparency features are great, but there are critical design flaws that simply cannot be ignored at that $500+ price point.

Google “condensation gate” and you will understand why these headphones don’t deserve your hard earned money. Moisture and electronics doesn’t mix. Why on earth would you waste money on a product that has a high likelihood of shorting out soon after the warranty expires?

The headband. I can’t even believe they poorly designed such a critical piece of the product. The headband’s support system is made out of (wait for it) MESH!!!!! Think about that folks. All that’s keeping the metal frame of the headphones from painfully resting DIRECTLY on your head is a very thin layer of mesh of which over time begins to sag, and when it does, the consumer instantly goes from having pain in their wallet, to pain on their head as well. I cannot for the life of me understand why they would have designed the headband with such a flimsy support system.

Comfort is a serious issue as well. The clamping force coupled with the sheer weight of the headphones is straight up ridiculous. I do not recommend these headphones at all. Not to mention the returns process is PAINFUL. I can only imagine that Apple makes it that way to discourage returns in general for products purchased through AMZ. You could potentially have to wait up to 30 days to get a refund due to Apple’s requirements to return this particular product.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2025

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars

reviewText:
I bought my husband these headphones because he wouldn’t buy them for himself. We went on a flight to see family and the noise canceling on these headphones is Amazing!! You can’t hear the sound from the plane itself and there was a few crying children on the flight that he said if you aren’t playing anything, you can’t hear the plane sounds but you can hear the children but as soon as he started some music or a movie, he couldn’t hear the children. He will get a lot of use out of these! Yes, they’re a bit pricey but they work really well!

Take not, he read an article that says the headphones work best with Apple products. We mostly use Apple so if you use other brands, it could effect your experience.

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars
 Great, but…
reviewText:
Audio
For a wireless headphone - The audio is very good. Great soundstage. Critical listening can be done with these…it won’t be the same as a wired headphone and amp. Enjoying music on the go is where it shines.

Device switching
Switching between Apple devices is tightly integrated and happens seamlessly. From iPad to iPhone to Mac to Apple TV.

Battery
No issues with battery …but…

Sucky stuff (tier 1 downside)
No dedicated power off switch. Although, via updates over the years, Apple has stubbornly added low power mode to save face for not having an off switch or feature. Weird.

Completely Insane (tier 2 downside)
Comes with a weird, bra-like case that offers no protection. All other competitors come with a hard case. So, you spend a sack of money on these and then have to spend extra on a case. INSANE! Apple Executives, are you aware that people have something called jobs and in these jobs we get paid something called salaries and these salaries when spent on items like these, should get us a complete purchase - especially at such a high price point.

BONKERS (tier 3 downside)
Ok! You’ve reached boss level of downsides. Apple reintroduced these in 2024 with a USB-C connector and no H2 chip - which is in the Airpod Pro earphones (UEM).

Dear God, why!?

I also own the Airpod Pro IEM and they’re AWESOME. Ability to answer or dismiss calls, start stop workouts etc, the noise protection while in transparency mode-
For example, a loud bang occurs while you’re in transparency mode - the Airpod Pros will mute the loud noise to save your hearing- the Max amplifies it. Yummy.

Then why get these - I wear them during the winter commutes - so they also double-duty as ear muffs. Also, when I put up my jacket hood, they don’t dislodge like the AirPod Pros and fall in the NYC sewers where the rats and CHUDs get to enjoy Jazz on my dime.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2025

reviewTitle: Amazing sound and comfort
reviewText: I’ve been using the Apple AirPods Max for a few days now, and I’m beyond impressed! The sound quality is absolutely top-notch. The clarity and richness of the audio are unmatched, whether I’m listening to music, watching movies, or taking calls. The spatial audio feature creates an immersive experience, making it feel like the sound is surrounding me.The noise cancellation is phenomenal. It completely blocks out background noise, which is perfect for focusing at work or during travel. The transparency mode is also seamless, allowing me to hear what’s around me without taking off the headphones.Yes, they’re pricey, but in my opinion, they’re worth every penny. If you’re looking for premium sound, comfort, and design, you won’t be disappointed.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 I love them, but not likely worth the super premium price unless you're 100% Apple
reviewText:
I struggled for a while to convince myself I should pay the massive premium for the AirPods Max. I pulled the trigger and don't really regret it.

The major, major pro is they actually seamlessly switch from my MacBook to iPad to iPhone. Connectivity is very reliable. I recently switched from windows to Mac, and not sure that was the right call, but some of MacBook features maybe make up for the 30 years of windows familiarity. I say that because without a MacBook for daily work use, I'd have less conviction on the reason to spend so much on headphones. The switching is super valuable for teams/zooms on laptop and then phone calls, or listening to podcasts on laptop or tv shows on iPad then phone calls.

In terms of ease of use, they are super easy. Just put on your head and all your devices activate and are ready to use. They are also comfortable. Other headsets I've had issues at the top of my head with the crossbar becoming uncomfortable after a while, which isn't the case with these.

Sound quality is quite good. Is it worth the premium to other high end headphones like Bose or Sony that get rated high, I'm not sure. My guess is not really. The Spatial Audio is weird. I love the idea, but not sure it seems immersive when my eyes are looking at a 13 laptop or 11" iPad
reviewDate: though it's fun to play with and hear the sound exclusively in my left ear when I look right and vice versa.

asin: Noise cancelling is very good. Again
reviewTitle: probably not. Music is great to listen to
reviewText: but while I have a decent ear for sound
reviewDate: I'm certainly not an audiophile.

reviewRating: the ambient noise can somewhat drown out the person you actually want to talk to. It can be better just to take it off one ear.
as you would expect from Apple.

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Underwhelming after 6 weeks
reviewText: Me saying this in retrospect but also giving an opinion: I got mines from Apple directly (in the mall); i’m doing a comparison with the one from Amazon and— this one. They’re the same, literally, the only difference is the noise cancellation, it allows some noise in, when you push the oval button for ANC. Besides ANC, transparency mode on this is extremely good for calls. I can only hear the person who i’m speaking with. For ANC it blocks out noise, and the music depending on what genre, could be EDM, pop music or bass boosted songs, it generally sounds more crispier on the higher spectrum. The mids on the other hand, have a more tumultuous sound in some songs that are quite notable. I should’ve gotten something else cheaper but the battery life is worser than the XM5s. Again just in general, super underwhelming after like 1-6 weeks. Even 1 week if you want a perpetual comfort experience.Audiophile opinion:  Most of you reading you’ve probably been watching videos on what’s the best pair of headphones in a general assessment. Kinda difficult to explain or give a definitive answer; since it all depends on user preferences. I Had the XM4s, 5s, bathys, even the recent earbud beats sets that i gave to my mom (Which was a disappointment from initial time of release). But yeah like i spent a lot of money over the years on sound quality, bass, mids, etc., but i can’t help myself make an apple airpods max pro with a USB-C review. With a more realistic perceptive on a general consumer basis.(1): For the Price, it’s underwhelming for what it is, i have a few problems with comfort as well.(2): Everything else is fine, it’s just that it squeezes my skull too much. The Sony XM4s feel super comfortable, even though they’re ugly, they feel much lighter too. They like feel so good but the Maxes, maxes out on the sound quality and ANC, for lack of a better word.(3): In hindsight, i feel like the connectivity should’ve been fixed for older iphones, i have the 8 plus still and the 12, both had eccentric connectivity glitches or bugs if that’s how you call it. But yeah like i just wish the value for money for the Maxes wasn’t so overpriced and overhyped.(4): And to wrap things up, for functionality; it works great. There’s a ton i didn’t mention but yeah.Overall experience, i give this a 4 stars, not 5 certainly not the best. I would say the XM5s for like a muddier bass or muffled in some cases. If you want to go for the Maxes for like general sound quality, if i mean so emphatically, for that purchase go for it. For comfort, it’s staggeringly out of place in terms of price, and it should be improved. But anyhow thanks for reading 👌.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2025

reviewTitle:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Basically the same as the lightning version ... with one surprise.
reviewText: Let me set the stage upfront. I love the Airpod Max as such for their build quality, features, and overall sound quality, especially when used with Apple devices. And to support that statement, I even side-graded" the Lightning version (2020) to the USB-C (2024). Now
reviewDate: there are no claims of any other changes than colors and the USB-charging port. Beyond that
column6: the hardware and functionality remain unchanged (i.e.
column7: no H2 chip). That said
column8: this is what I assumed
column9: and it holds mostly true except for one surprise.I don't have to spend much time on the great build quality
column10: excellent ANC (active noise cancellation) and good sound quality. Many have written about the equally high price and the nearly pointless smart case. Depending on your preferences
column11: those are all true or overblown.The premium (metal) build makes this headset sturdy and somewhat heavy. By itself
column12: not a major deal
column13: but when added to other devices
column14: every gram counts in the carry-on luggage. But weight is ironically not the biggest issue for travelers. People already criticized the Lightning version for its missing 3.5mm port for traditional audio cables
column15: like those used with in-flight entertainment systems. The 2024 update does not change that. What appears to be a logical change from lightning connector to USB-C turns out to be a puzzling omission.The 2024 version may now charge via a common USB-C cable
column16: and the mentioned Lightning audio cable naturally wouldn't fit
column17: but as of January '25 there is no sign of a (custom) audio cable for wired audio. A generic 3.5mm to USB-C cable will not work
column18: and it's not clear that the headphones even have the capability or if there ever will be such cable! I find this rather bold to keep the design effectively the same and yet remove one feature. Sure
column19: there is an increasing number of 3.5mm to wireless (BT5.x) dongles
column20: but it still feels like a downgrade
column21: and it's one more device you need to keep charged.Overall
column22: the headphones are a solid 4.5 in terms of ANC
column24: and sound. If you already own the Lightning version
column25: I feel this USB-C is in no way an upgrade and may even be the downgrade I mentioned above. Part of me would like to see a truly upgraded AirPod Max 2 with H2 chip and fewer limitations
column26: even if that means that my most recent update to the USB-C version was not the best use of my resources."
column27: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2025

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Only worth it when it's on sale
reviewText: I'm an audiophile snob, but I also accept things for what they are and not think of products negatively just because they're not something they're not. I'm going to pragmatic as possible and talk about the APMs (AirPods Max) and how they perform from my perspective as an audiophile.First note: I'm kind of tired of people asking if these headphones can play Hi-Res Lossless" with their Apple Music
reviewDate: even if the song was mastered this way. The APMs maxes out at 24 bit 48khz
column6: which makes it capable for regular "Lossless" and "Dolby Atmos".Sound Quality:I would say that the sound quality is good
column7: but in a highly corrected and synthesized way. It just sounds "clean" that you get with these modern bluetooth headphones. I'm ok with this and accept this for what it is and I'm not expecting Focal Clear OG or MG levels of sound quality via analog DAC and Amp combo. I can also say that I prefer the timbre coming from the APM vs. the Bose QCs or the Sony XM. The latter two has better ANCs
column8: but I personally think the APMs have a more neutral sound profile. If you want the best BT wireless headphones that's tuned very well
column9: look into the Focal Bathys.ANCsI think the ANCs got worse with the APMs as Apple pushed out some firmware update for it in the last couple of years. Transparency mode is top notch and still considered one of the best
column10: but if you're looking for raw ANC tuning
column11: I would still say that the Sony XMs and Bose QCs are superior
column12: but not by much. The Focal Bathys is very good in this regard
column13: but I would personally place those in last place from the other three.Practical Build QualityThese are much better build quality than the Bose and the Sony
column14: which were designed to be mass produced
column15: built to meet profit margins type of headphones. The APMs feels much more premium in comparison
column16: however Apple still have no figured out or fixed the moisture build up issue (your miles may vary) if you're the type to build up moisture around you ear. Also the travel/charging case for the APMs are some of the worst designed - ever. It's annoying that it doesn't fold
column17: but I don't think that's fair to say because the Focal Bathys doesn't fold either and it's just as bulky.The main reason why you buy these:You just want headphones that meshes super well with your other Apple devices due to the (now 4 years old) H1 chip that seamlessly connects to all your Apple devices. This is something that none of the other ANC BT headphones can match on any level. Even with the Focal Bathys
column18: which trounces the APMs in terms of audio quality
column19: I use less and less because the APMs are just so much more convenient to use.Elephant in the room:The Apple H1 chip is old AF and with this latest release of the USB-C model
column20: this is an obvious sign that Apple has no plans to further improve the Airpods Max as part of their roadmap. While their other Airpods like the Pros and their regular series of Airpods continue to receive cutting edge updates (H2 chip and better ANC technology)
column21: the 2024 APMs are recycled version of the 2020 APMs with USB-C at best. I would personally save your money and not purchase these at full price for such out of date and blatant money grab at $549."

reviewTitle:

    Amazing, but overpriced.
reviewText: These headphones are VERY comfortable & the Spatial Audio is fantastic w/ great noise canceling. However, the mic is average and not the best for remote working in public spaces, and its other features are not so much better than the competition to justify the price. They also have zero water resistance, whereas others have at least IPX4 water resistance, so these would not be great workout headphones. There’s no off button, it expects you to use the case. Otherwise it goes to sleep while draining battery the whole time. Lastly, not great outside the apple ecosystem— like if you use other Bluetooth devices or PCs not Apple.In the end, they are just headphones, only one main function — and I could not justify spending more than $400 (even after tax) on these, let alone the $500+ listed price tag.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Worth every penny for peace and perfection
reviewText:
I absolutely love my AirPods Max. They’re everything I could want in over-ear headphones and more. First off, they’re amazing ear muffs in the winter—cozy and practical! The noise cancellation is brilliant and blocks out everything, whether it’s a noisy commute or the chaos of my house while I’m cooking dinner. The sound quality is superb, and phone calls are crystal clear. They hold a charge for nearly all day, which is a lifesaver.

I’ve tried Bose and Sony over-ear headphones, and while they’re great, the seamless connectivity across my Apple devices is what makes these stand out. Switching between my iPhone, iPad, and MacBook is effortless.

Sure, they’re pricey, but for the comfort, sound quality, and ease of use, they’re worth it. And yes, I’m a grown woman who probably looks like I’m about to jump into a Call of Duty game while wearing them—but I don’t care. These headphones are a game-changer for anyone who values peace, focus, and great sound. Highly recommend!
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2025

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Sounds amazing
reviewText:
If you’re looking for a pair of wireless earbuds for working out, Apple AirPods are a fantastic choice. The sound quality is truly impressive—crisp, clear, and rich, whether you’re listening to music, podcasts, or taking calls. For workouts, the most important thing to know is their fit and performance during physical activity. The snug fit ensures they stay in place, even during intense exercises.

Another standout feature is the variety of colors available; I love the one I chose! It adds a touch of personality, making them feel unique and stylish. The seamless connection with Apple devices is also a game-changer. You can switch between devices effortlessly, and the long battery life means they’ll keep up with you throughout your workout and beyond.

Overall, if sound quality, style, and convenience are high on your priority list, Apple AirPods are an excellent investment for fitness enthusiasts.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2025

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Great headphones
reviewText:
I have many sets of headphones, some very nice ones, and these stand alone in terms of being something different - there is so much tech jammed into these, it makes them very different than anything else on the market.

Sound - Sound quality on these is very good, very clean. Personally I'd like a lot more bass, but even someone who isn't a basshead would still probably like more bass. They're not weak or anything on the low end side, and booming bass is there, it's just too much in the background for my tastes. If stupid iOS just gave you an EQ, you could probably easily fix this, and some of the sound profiles you do get can hep, but for the love of everything, just give me a stupid EQ so I can choose the sound I want. In any case, again, the sound is very good, very clean. I'd say it's pretty easily better than my Bose QC25 but not on-par with my Beyerdynamic DT 990 open backed headphones (which I still think are the best headphones I've heard and I've compared them against sets costing well over $1k). But these headphones are about a lot more than sound, and that's why they go up to 5-stars...

Sound Field/Stage - The sound stage on these, the openness of the sound, is amazing for closed back headphones. When you're playing music that supports Apples spatial sound (everything in Apple Music for example) it's incredible, it really feels/sounds natural a lot of the time. I've used other 'virtual surround' garbage, and it's terrible, but whatever Apple is doing, it works. My favorite thing is that you can set your phone in front of you, then walk around, and it sounds like the sound is coming from the direction of the iPhone, so it gives you this incredible sense of space (and it does not hurt the sound quality - for most music it sounds better in my opinion). This is something you really have to experience to understand as I don't know of anyone else that does this - and it's really impressive in person.

Noise Cancelling - Absolutely top notch. Between the good fit of the headphones and the actual tech, you can block out a ton of stuff, they work better than my Bose QC25's, that still were best in class as of a year ago. Also, for the cry babies, I do not notice the pressure effect - it might be there still, but it's not nearly as noticeable as the Bose.

Battery Life - Seems to be excellent. Only downside is it uses an iPhone plug, not USB C. I still have and need an iPhone plug so it's not a huge deal at the moment, but for the future, when it's all USB C, this is going to become a pain.

Comfort - It's pretty comfortable. I heard lots of people say these are big and heavy and uncomfortable, and while they are big and heavy, for me at least they're pretty comfortable. Those Beyerdynamic DT 990 are amazingly comfortable, can wear them for hours, that's not the case here. But compared to my Bose QC25, I can wear the AirPods Max for longer without any issues. Still, it's not like the comfort of earbuds, which I can wear all day, but for big over the ear headphones, the Max's are pretty good.

Build Quality - Top notch in my opinion, make everything else I've ever used, anything else I've ever even tried, feel plasticky and cheap.

Wireless - No lag, no drops, works great. I wish they had upped the bandwidth so you could carry stuff like fully uncompressed audio, like blu-ray audio, but probably have to wait for V2 for that. With that said, I've never really noticed anything, everything sounds full with no compression. Obviously that isn't the case, but just saying, I do not notice any negatives as far as wireless goes.

Overall, 5-stars. The sound, with less bass than I'd like and with no EQ in iOS, only gets 4-stars, but the other features make these unique and quite amazing. The spatial sound is what makes these special, and you can't get that with any other over the ear headphones, and it works remarkably well. I think it uses actual head movement for tracking, so it's not just a software gimmick they can do on any other headphones (I think that's the case), but it' something you need to hear in person to appreciate.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2021

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 blew my mind
reviewText: Why aren’t all headphones this nice??? I wish I’d bought these ages ago. They fit my head perfectly without sliding around or needing adjustments constantly. The music quality when paired with Lossless Audio on Apple Music is pretty astounding. The quality of these can’t be matched - the metal frame and sophisticated design make for heavy, but excellent, product. The battery life seems great so far - I’ve listened to a few hours uninterrupted and haven’t had to charge them yet. Honestly, the price point here sounds insane, especially because they charge via lightning cable and not USB-C. However, you get a product that I just can’t dismiss because of the price tag. The performance so far is simply astounding. Thanks to Prime Day prices, I finally bit the bullet, and I’m soooo glad I did.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Great product but returned due to fit
reviewText: I gave these 5 stars because I absolutely loved these headphones but ended up returning them due to them being uncomfortable. The sound and noise cancellation was great and definitely better than the AirPod Pros. The reason I returned them was because they squeezed too hard on the arms of my glasses, so after I wore them for longer than 20-30 minutes I would start to get a headache. I have the thicker plastic framed glasses and just felt like these weren’t the right choice for that, this isn’t a problem I’ve had with some other over the ear headphones. When I wore them without glasses this was not a problem at all and I thought they were really comfortable. I have some friends that have these and they have the wire frame glasses and they did not have this problem either. If you’re planning to buy these and have the types of glasses that I do, just make sure to give them a heavy trial run before the return window closes. I was able to return them without any problems and got my full refund. I also got a refund back for my Apple care which I’ve seen is not always the case so that was an unexpected surprise. All in all I definitely recommend these to anyone who doesn’t wear glasses/has smaller frames.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2023

reviewTitle:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Random crackling and distortion
reviewText: Hello!I've had these headphones in my cart for a while and thought I'd bite the bullet during this most recent prime day. Love the look. Yes, they are heavy but whatever I honestly like it. Noise canceling is also great which is a big thing for me! I've had the Bose headphones for a while and the most recent Bose QuietComfort are lacking in the noise canceling department. Big reason why I decided to look elsewhere!Now, I haven't had these headphones for a while. I JUST opened them yesterday. First song I listened to was great. Second song I listened to was going well until I opened iMessage. The song started to distort. I was really confused so I backed up to make sure it wasn't the song. It wasn't. Right now I am listening again and while I'm toggling through different sites on my web browser, and even clicking on the different colors that the headphones have to offer, the headphones are giving off a static and crackling sound. I'm just a little nervous since I JUST bought these and this has started to happen right off the bat.Has this happened to anyone else? Does it get better? Does it get worse? These are so expensive and if this is going to keep happening I'm gonna be pretty disappointed :/ Gonna keep using them and will change my rating if I feel it gets better but for now... yeah I'm unsure! Sucks because the sound quality when this isn't an issue is great... but it just keeps happening!For the record - I am using Spotify and have connected the headphones to my iPhone 14 pro max and my 2022 Macbook air. First use was on my phone and second was on my computer.Anyways, this was fun I don't usually leave reviews hahah. Hope this is helpful.

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    They’re great headphones overall!
reviewText: Ok, I’ve had these for a few weeks now and here’s my thoughts.First, the pros. Honestly they are pretty comfortable and yes, very pretty. Let’s be honest, who doesn’t love Apple’s aesthetic? I got the green color and it’s gorgeous. I love that they come with a nice little case too. The battery life is great, I can do about a weeks worth of workouts without going below 25% battery. They also charge super quickly. The sound quality is good! They’re also nicely padded. They also stay put while I’m running which is a huge plus.Cons: the sound is good, but I don’t think they’re $500 good. I really wanted to wait for the next gen to come out but I don’t think they’ll be out for quite a while from what I have heard so I bit the bullet and splurged. I did buy a case for the actual headphones because I don’t love that the fabric padding gets so sweaty when I work out, but the case I bought seems to help with this a lot. All in all, they’re probably the best headphones I have used to date. However, there is always room for improvement (:

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Nearly perfect - the Apple AirPods Max falls short in one small but annoying way
reviewText: I recently purchased the Apple AirPods Max and have been extremely happy with my purchase - with one small exception. These headphones are absolutely amazing in every other way - the sound quality is top-notch, the noise cancellation is excellent, and the build quality is top-notch. The case is also a nice touch - it's convenient and protects the headphones when I'm on the go.However, there is one small issue that has been driving me crazy - the inability to turn off the headphones without putting them back in the case. This is a feature that doesn't help to conserve battery life, and can be extremely inconvenient when I just want to take a quick break from listening to music or make a phone call without having to fumble with the case. It's a small annoyance, but one that I hope Apple will address in future versions of the AirPods Max.Overall, despite this one small issue, I am extremely happy with my purchase of the Apple AirPods Max. They are a truly top-notch pair of headphones and I would highly recommend them to anyone in search of excellent sound quality and noise cancelling technology. Just be prepared to put up with the minor inconvenience of having to put them back in the case to turn them off.

reviewTitle:

    Life changing
reviewText: I do not usually review products, AND these have literally been life changing. I have become an audiophile, have a small head (most adult/quality headphones are too big/heavy), wear glasses (turns out this combination gives bad headaches if you feel your head is in a vice) and have long hair (meaning in-ear headphones often times give static feedback as my hair rubs against the microphone). I have spent hundreds of dollars trying to find a just right audio/headphone options and regret not initially investing in these. They fit my small sized head, are not too tight, completely cover my ears to not hurt/irritate my earring holes/ears or weigh on/squeeze my head/glasses. The audio quality is amazing and they pair with my other apple devices (computer/phone) seamlessly. I can wear them over one ear or both (as I have kids and audio-feedback from the environment is often helpful). These drown out irritating noises and I love the controls. I also appreciate that if I pull an earphone away from my head to listen to something/hear someone everything is paused for a moment and resumes when I put them back over my ear. So practical and helpful. The only concern I have is not being able to tell the difference between quality sound coming from speakers everyone can hear or headphones...and my heart Is happy and quality of life improved exponentially.

    Not substantially better than airpod pros unless volume is turned up
reviewText: At about double the cost of the airpod pros, I've found that the maxes unfortunately do not provide double the listening experience. I do find that I'm able to pick up more details, and am occasionally delighted at new sounds I'm able to hear, but I would say that overall these delights do not justify the large price tag, at least with respect to audio quality.That said, the noise cancellation is really, really good. It's made cross-country flights (in the United States) much more enjoyable, and I look forward to wearing this on my trip to Korea (about 14 hours.) In addition, the long battery life is much welcomed. Unfortunately, the headphones do apply some pressure to my head, and I find that I need to take a break from them after 2-3 hours. During this time, I swap my airpod earbuds in, and the difference in noise cancellation is always very noticeable.All in all, the Airpod Max, does not give me a drastically improved listening experience, but makes up for it with its much longer battery life and noise cancellation.

I will say it does stop after continuous use (and I personally am willing to let it slide), but definitely worth mentioning for people with potential sensory sensitivities. The noise cancellation is phenomenal as always, and the volume control is the cherry. Going from AirPods to these, the volume control wheel is a lifesaver. I adore these. I use them frequently and I would purchase them again, even if they are expensive. To me, they are worth every penny. 10/10

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Game changer
reviewText: Almost pristine noise cancellation - an ideal solution for a complex problem. Heightens focus and productivity while working, and calms when at rest. I use them with meditation apps, podcasts, music, and film/video. All flawlessly connect and the sound quality is awe-inspiring. These are a gift that will continue giving back with time the longer you keep them.One drawback that I have found is the tendency for the cushions to absorb sweat and take on odor. After finding their instructions on cleaning the cushions on their website unhelpful, I spoke with Apple support, who advise using a dryer sheet to clean the cushions. This helps, but there is a tendency for the product to get dingy with lots of use. There should be more water resistance and more ways to clean the ear cushions.Update: while you won’t find this piece of advice on the forums, a trick for cleaning the smell out of the cushions is non-chlorine bleach, e.g. oxyclean liquid. Spray on the cushions and let it penetrate, then leave them under a fan to dry. I tried putting the cushions in the freezer to get the smell out, but the best bet was non-chlorine bleach.

Confession I’ve got about 18 sets of cans (over ears) and in ears. I’ve not stopped listening to the AirPod Max since I got them.
